title: Assistant Property Manager
description:

Responsibilities

• Assisting with onboarding new properties

• Keeping records and systems accurate and up to date

• Supporting senior tea
mbers with general administrative tasks

• Comfortable juggling multiple tasks at once

• Good initiative and ability to work independently

• Experience in property or administration is helpful but not required

title: Training, Learning & Automation Specialist
description:
About Bare:



At Bare, we're focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.



Since launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low-cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning, and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families to deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable, and sustainable way.



The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product and service that is category-leading.

The Role:



We’re looking for a Training, Learning & Automation Specialist to design, build and scale our internal learning ecosystem while embedding automation and AI-driven efficiency across training, onboarding and operational workflows.

This is not a traditional L&D role. You’ll sit at the intersection of people, systems, and technology — creating structured learning programs while automating repetitive processes to support a fast-growing, multi-functional team.

You’ll work closely with Operations, Customer Care, Sales, Finance and Leadership to ensure our team is highly trained, efficient, and continuously improving.



Key Responsibilities:



Learning & Development:



-Design and deliver structured onboarding programs across departments (Funeral Arrangers, Sales, Operations, Finance).

-Build scalable e-learning modules, SOP documentation and knowledge libraries.

-Create competency frameworks and capability pathways.

-Facilitate live and virtual training sessions.

-Develop assessment tools to measure skill acquisition and performance uplift.

-Maintain compliance training relevant to Australian funeral and regulatory requirements.



Systems & Automation:



-Identify repetitive manual processes and design automated workflows.

-Implement automation tools (CRM automations, LMS workflows, AI-based support tools).

-Integrate training content into internal systems for seamless adoption.

-Build dashboards to track learning progress, productivity and operational KPIs.

-Collaborate with tech and operations teams to improve internal tooling.





Continuous Improvement:



-Analyse performance data to identify skill gaps.

-Translate operational bottlenecks into structured learning solutions.

-Implement feedback loops to refine training programs.

-Support change management during process or system upgrades.



What Success Looks Like:



-New hires reach full productivity faster.

-Training is systemised, documented and easily scalable.

-Manual tasks are reduced through automation.

-Teams demonstrate measurable performance improvement.

-Leadership has visibility on capability metrics.



About You:



-3+ years in Learning & Development, Enablement, Operations Improvement or similar.

-Experience implementing automation tools (e.g., Zapier, HubSpot workflows, Notion, LMS platforms, AI tools).

-Strong systems thinker who enjoys process optimisation.

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

-Highly organised with strong attention to detail.

-Analytical and data-driven in decision making.

-Proactive, solution-oriented and commercially aware.

-Experience in xero, google sheet and CRM (Hubspot) and integrations between systems



Bonus Experience:



-Experience in high-growth startups.

-Experience in regulated industries.

-Familiarity with CRM systems and workflow automation.

-Exposure to AI tools for training and operational efficiency.



Please include your resume in your application.

title: Recruitment & Talent Acquisition Virtual Assistant (Healthcare Clinics – Canada)
description:
About Us



Pain Free Health is a fast-growing multidisciplinary healthcare group based in British Columbia, Canada. We operate modern clinics offering Chiropractic, Physiotherapy, Massage Therapy, Acupuncture, and Medical services.



We are expanding and looking for a highly organized, proactive Recruitment VA to help us consistently attract and hire top-tier healthcare professionals and clinic staff.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for sourcing, screening, organizing, and coordinating candidates for our clinics. Your job is to build and maintain a strong talent pipeline.



This is not just posting jobs — this is strategic recruiting.



Responsibilities



Job Posting & Sourcing

 • Create and post job ads

 • Source candidates directly on LinkedIn and other platforms

 • Track applicant volume and performance of job ads

Reporting

 • Weekly report including:

 • # of applicants

 • screened

 • shortlisted

 • interviews booked

 • Hiring status



Ideal Candidate



Experience recruiting for healthcare or skilled professionals

Excellent written English

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Proactive and independent



Bonus if you:

 • Have recruited for Canadian or US businesses

 • Understand healthcare roles (RMT, Physio, Chiro, etc.)

title: Social Media Coordinator – Stock Photo Library
description:
Austockphoto is a growing Australian stock photo library representing talented photographers and authentic, local imagery. We work with designers, agencies, publishers and brands who need high-quality, real Australian content.



We’re looking for a creative, detail-oriented Social Media Coordinator to help bring our collection to life across social platforms.



About the role



This is a remote, part-time role (approximately 5 hours per week to start).



You will:



• Write engaging, on-brand captions for Instagram,
 and 

• Schedule posts using our scheduling platform

• Assist with planning weekly content themes

• Repurpose content across platforms

• Suggest simple content ideas that support growth and engagement

• All images will be selected by our team — your role is to craft compelling captions and present them strategically.



Over time, there may be opportunities to assist with:



• E-newsletters

• Basic analytics reporting

• Community engagement (comments and DMs)

• Broader marketing tasks



We are a growing business with a small but highly capable remote team. If you demonstrate strong capability and initiative, the role can expand.



Who we’re looking for



You:



• Have excellent written English

• Understand tone, storytelling and audience awareness

• Are confident writing for creative industries

• Are organised and comfortable working independently

• Have experience scheduling social media content

• Have strong attention to detail



Bonus if you:



• Have first-hand experience of Australian culture (this is our #1 focus)

• Have worked with creative businesses or photographers

• Understand stock photography or licensing

• Have experience with Instagram growth strategy



To apply



Please include:



• A short introduction about yourself

• A link to any social accounts you have managed



Please use this exact subject line:

Stock photo library Social Media Coordinator

title: Insurance Claims Adjuster Virtual Assistant (Remote)
description:
We are hiring a reliable Virtual Assistant for a specific, one-time assignment to complete an online Insurance Claims Adjuster training course. This assignment is approximately 40 hours and must be completed within one week or sooner.



Your responsibility is to go through the full course, complete all quizzes and exams, and demonstrate understanding of the material.



This is not a permanent position. This is a project-based assignment only.



Assignment Responsibilities:



Complete the assigned Insurance Adjuster course (approx. 40 hours)



Pass all quizzes and exams in the course



Take notes and understand the material



Provide proof of completion and quiz/exam results



Answer the screening questions below based on what you learned



Compensation:



$3–$4/hour (International Applicants)



Total Project: Approx. $120–$160



Paid after successful completion and verification



Application Instructions:



After completing the course,
 the following to:







Subject Line: Adjuster Course Assignment – [Your Name]



Include:



Resume



Proof of course completion



Quiz and exam results



Answers to the questions below



Course Questions:



What is the role of an insurance claims adjuster?



Explain the difference between ACV and RCV.



What is depreciation?



What are the steps in handling a claim from start to finish?



What did you learn from the course?



Important:



This position is for completing this course assignment only. There is no guarantee of long-term employment, but future assignments may be available based on performance.



Only apply if you are ready to start immediately.

Job Descriptions:



Manage eCommerce merchandising, upload content and digital assets, and ensure proper display.

Analyze performance of products on Amazon/Ebay/Walmart and suggest strategies for improvement, such as content, reviews, pricing, or merchandising.

Identify and develop upsell opportunities.

Oversee day-to-day operations, including product content, inventory, pricing, and promotions to optimize revenue and conversion.

title: Sales Operations Lead — Outbound Systems Builder
description:
About Us

We help property management companies and rental property owners eliminate operational overhead using AI and automation. Our clients manage 100+ rental units on AppFolio. We're early-stage, pre-revenue, and need someone to build and own our outbound sales engine. 

This is not a "follow the playbook" role. We're figuring out the offer and market together. You'll be a partner in that process, not just an executor.



What You'll Own

1. Outbound Engine

Responsibility: Build sequences, automations, lead lists, CRM workflows



2. Channel Execution

Responsibility: Cold
, LinkedIn,
, cold calling — you d
 priority



3. Testing & Iteration

Responsibility: Test messaging and offers. Report what's working. Kill what isn't



4. Metrics

Responsibility: Own the funnel: sent ? replied ? booked ? closed. Weekly reporting



5. Hiring (Later)

Responsibility: Once system works, hire/manage junior executors below you



Initial Focus (First 30 Days)

1. Choose ONE primary outbound channel

2. Build the system end-to-end

3. First outreach live within 7 days of start

4. Hit 10+ qualified conversations/week before adding new channels

No "two weeks of research" before anything happens.



What Success Looks Like

Week 1: First outreach sent, first replies coming in

Week 4: Predictable weekly call volume, clear data on what's converting

Month 3: Repeatable system producing 10+ qualified calls/week with documented playbooks



Requirements

Must Have:

- Built or managed a multi-channel outbound system before (not just executed one channel)

- Experience with sales tools: Apollo, Instantly, SmartLead, LinkedIn Sales Nav, or similar

- Proof of results: pipelines built, conversations generated, conversion metrics

- Strong written and spoken English

- Comfortable with ambiguity — offer and messaging will iterate based on market feedback 



Bonus:

- Experience in real estate, property management, or B2B services

- Can hire and manage cold callers / appointment setters

- Copywriting skills

- Experience with Clay, Phantombuster, Make, or automation tools



Compensation

- Base: $12-18/hr depending on experience

- Performance Bonuses:

$10 per qualified call booked (prospect has 100+ units, uses AppFolio, agrees to call)

$500 per closed deal

Top performers earn significantly more than base through results.



What You're NOT Doing

- Pitching pricing or closing deals — I handle sales calls

- Spending weeks "setting up infrastructure" before first outreach

- Waiting for perfect messaging — we test and iterate live



How to Apply

Fill up this form:

title: Property Management Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Yardi)
description:
Remote | Part-Time to Start (20–30 hrs/week)



We are a U.S.-based property management company looking for a dedicated bookkeeper with hands-on experience in QuickBooks and Yardi to support our growing portfolio.



This role is focused on accounting and bookkeeping, not sales or marketing. You will work closely with ownership and an existing operations team to reduce workload, improve accuracy, and bring structure to our financial processes.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Bookkeeping and accounting in QuickBooks

- Working inside Yardi for property-level accounting

- Accounts payable (vendor bills, utilities, insurance, taxes, fees)

- Reconciling bank accounts and property accounts

- Rent posting and basic delinquency tracking

- Supporting month-end close

- Light data entry related to property accounting

- Coordinating with the operations team when information is missing or unclear



This is not an “everything role.”

Your primary responsibility is accounting accuracy and consistency.



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

- QuickBooks: real, hands-on bookkeeping experience

- Yardi: direct experience using Yardi for property management

- Prior work with property management or real estate accounting

- Strong attention to detail

- Comfortable working with multiple properties and vendors

If you have Yardi experience but are weaker in QuickBooks, you must be willing and able to learn quickly.



Nice to Have (Not Required)

- Experience with U.S. property management companies

- Familiarity with utilities, insurance, and property taxes

- Experience supporting audits or cleanups

- Ability to document processes clearly



Work Setup & Pay

- Remote (Philippines preferred)

- Part-time to start (20–30 hours/week)

- Hourly pay: $6–$8 USD/hour, based on experience

- Opportunity for increased hours and long-term role if successful



Who This Role Is For

- You are a specialist, not a generalist

- You prefer clear responsibilities and structure

- You take ownership of accuracy

- You communicate when something is missing or unclear instead of guessing



Who This Role Is NOT For

- “Jack-of-all-trades” VAs

- Candidates with only theoretical QuickBooks knowledge

- Candidates who have never worked inside Yardi

- Anyone looking for a sales or customer-facing role



How to Apply

Please complete the form here: 



Applications without specific QuickBooks and Yardi experience will not be considered.

title: Cold Calling Sales Closer
description:
We are growing our dog accessories division by bringing handcrafted Maasai leather beaded collars to pet lovers and retailers around the world. These collars are made by skilled Maasai artisans in Kenya, combining cultural heritage, premium leather and durable, water-resistant construction. The result is a unique, story-driven product that helps stores stand out and delight their customers.



As a Cold Calling Sales Closer, you own the entire sales cycle on the phone: from first contact with qualified leads to closing initial orders and repeat purchases. You will speak directly with pet retailers, groomers, boarding facilities and importers, present our product, handle objections and secure sales. Your income grows with your results through a monthly salary plus a commission-based structure.



What you will do

- Filter & Call qualified leads from our database and introduce our products.

- Identify quickly if the prospect is a retailer, groomer, boarding facility, vet clinic or importer, and adapt your pitch.

- Present the product clearly: benefits, premium look and in-store positioning.

- Ask targeted questions to understand their business.

- Handle objections  and turn them into opportunities.

- Close sales directly on the call.

- Follow up with warm prospects and turn interest into paid orders.

- Keep accurate notes in the CRM so nothing falls through the cracks.

- Share patterns and feedback with the team to improve scripts, offers and targeting.



We’re not looking for someone who

- Only books meetings and avoids asking for the order.

- Is uncomfortable discussing price or negotiating on the phone.

- Needs a large fixed salary and dislikes performance-based pay.

- Reads scripts word-for-word without listening or adapting.

- Avoids high outbound activity or takes rejection personally.



What’s in it for you

High earning potential through a commission-based model with uncapped upside.

A differentiated, easy-to-love product with a real story behind it.

Direct, visible impact on company growth with clear revenue attribution.

Remote-friendly setup and flexibility to organize your calling blocks.

Growth opportunities into Senior Closer, Key Account or Sales Team Lead.

Preferred experience



Must have

1–3+ years of experience in phone-based sales (telesales, outbound closing, SDR/BDR with closing responsibilities, etc.).

Proven track record of selling directly on calls, not just setting appointments.

Strong bias for action and comfort with daily activity and revenue targets.

Excellent spoken English and a clear, confident phone presence.

Strong listening and objection-handling skills; you are comfortable asking for the sale.

Comfortable with a fixed salary plus commission-based or commission-heavy pay structures.

Solid discipline in using CRM tools and following up.

Good, stable internet connection suitable for VoIP calls and remote work.

Resilience, persistence and a genuine growth mindset.



Nice to have

Experience selling to small businesses in the pet industry (retailers, groomers, vet clinics, distributors).

Experience in international sales or working across time zones.

High tech literacy with sales tools and AI assistants.

Background in sales, customer service or operations where you owned a target.



Recruitment process

Application with short Job requirements testing

Sales interview focused on your past closing experience and results.

Live cold-call simulation with feedback.

Final interview to align on commission structure, targets and ramp-up.

Reference check.

Offer.



We value real skills and real outcomes. If you are not willing to do a short live role-play or share a sample call (even anonymized), this is probably not the right role for you.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Cloud Security Technical Lead (Microsoft 365 Focus)
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Company: Australia-based Managed IT & Security Provider



About Us



We’re an Australia-based IT Managed Services & Security provider that has been helping businesses for 8+ years with Managed IT, Microsoft 365 Security, and Essential 8 compliance. We’re now on a mission to scale rapidly and are looking for a Senior PH Technical Lead who can own delivery discipline, enforce SOPs, and mentor the team while keeping clients secure.



The Role



This isn’t just another engineering job. You will be the backbone of our offshore team, ensuring tickets are triaged, SLA discipline is followed, and our security-first approach (M365 + Essential 8) is consistently applied.



Key Responsibilities



- Triage & Ticket Discipline : Own daily triage rotation, enforce SOPs, ensure zero tickets are left untriaged at EOD.

- QA & Standards : Review ticket quality, escalate misses, and enforce client comms standards.

- M365 Security Leadership :  Drive improvements in Secure Score, Conditional Access, Intune, and Essential 8 L1 compliance.

- Mentorship : Guide and upskill junior PH engineers, enforce accountability.

- Client Impact : Collaborate with AU engineers to ensure top clients have strong security + reduced ticket backlog.



Requirements

3+ years MSP experience (non-negotiable). You must be comfortable with SLA-driven environments and ticketing systems (Halo, ConnectWise, Autotask, etc.).

Strong hands-on skills in:

Microsoft 365 Admin, Security & Compliance, Intune, Conditional Access

Essential 8 or similar cyber frameworks

Experience leading small teams or mentoring juniors.

Excellent written English for ticket notes + client comms.

Proactive mindset — you don’t wait, you enforce.



Why Join Us?



Career Pathway: Step into a Service Delivery Lead (PH) role as we grow.

Stable Company: 8+ years serving Australian businesses, strong client base.

Growth Mission: Be part of scaling rapidly — your impact will be visible.

Culture: We run on SOPs, discipline, and a no-blame mindset. If you want to grow, this is the place.



Compensation

title: Fractional Client Success Manager
description:
Role Overview

Fusion Vine is hiring a Fractional Client Success Manager to proactively manage client relationships, prevent churn, and identify growth opportunities. This role is ideal for candidates with strong English communication skills, a commercially-minded approach, and experience managing multiple client accounts.

This is a fractional, proactive client relationship role — not reactive support. You will serve as the human face of the agency, ensuring clients are informed, engaged, and satisfied.



Key Goal

Maintain high client satisfaction, prevent churn, and initiate account growth opportunities to support revenue and agency scaling.



Responsibilities

Maintain proactive communication with all active clients (minimum bi-weekly touchpoints)





Monitor account health signals and flag at-risk accounts to CEO





Conduct retention conversations to prevent churn





Identify underutilized accounts and expansion opportunities





Coordinate with Operations Coordinator to confirm delivery capacity before committing to new scope





Escalate strategic decisions and agency partner concerns to CEO





Document all client interactions, risks, and opportunities in project management systems





Communicate client feedback and change requests clearly to internal team







Requirements

Near-native English fluency (written and spoken)





Available 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM EST, Monday–Friday (mandatory)





2+ years experience in client-facing roles (client success, account management, or equivalent)





Experience managing multiple clients simultaneously





Proactive communicator, self-directed, and commercially aware





Reliable high-speed internet and professional remote setup





Comfortable using project management and CRM tools







Nice to Have

Experience with US clients from offshore locations





Background in marketing, content, SEO, or digital agency environments





Experience managing white-label or agency partner relationships





Familiarity with content production workflows





Experience identifying and initiating upsell/expansion conversations







Compensation



Rate determined by experience, skills, and performance during probation





Path to full-time and higher pay based on performance







Why Join Fusion Vine?

Fully remote work environment





Opportunity for long-term growth based on results





Clear processes, metrics, and expectations





Hands-on experience managing US-facing clients





Performance-based advancement





Be the human face of the agency for real client impact

title: Structural Engineer (Virtual Assistant) – Modular & Steel Construction
description:
Structural Engineer (Virtual Assistant) – Modular & Steel Construction



Full-Time | Remote | Australian Company



BB Building Services & Rapid Modular Homes are growing, and we’re looking for a highly capable Structural Engineer (Remote / VA) to join our team long-term.



We design and build modular homes, sheds, and steel structures across regional NSW, Australia. We are building repeatable systems — not one-off guesswork — and we need an engineer who can design properly, think critically, and work closely with our estimator and draftsman.



This is a serious role with long-term opportunity.



???? Your Role



You will:



Design structural steel systems for modular buildings



Perform structural calculations (wind, loads, lifting, transport etc.)



Prepare full calculation reports



Review and improve shop drawings



Design footings and slab systems



Work closely with our draftsman and estimator



Prepare complete engineering packages ready for Australian certification review



Help us refine and standardise our modular system



You will not be certifying projects (Australian engineers will do final sign-off), but your work must be accurate and certifiable.



???? Required Experience



You must have:



5+ years structural engineering experience



Strong steel design experience



Experience with portal frames / light gauge steel



Experience designing for wind loads



Experience preparing structural calculation reports



Proficiency in ETABS, STAAD, SAP2000, Tekla, or similar



Strong English communication skills



Bonus points if you have:



Modular / prefabricated construction experience



Experience working with Australian or international codes



Experience designing transportable structures



???????? Knowledge of Australian Standards (Preferred)



Experience or willingness to work within:



AS 4100 – Steel Structures



AS/NZS 1170 – Structural Design Actions



AS 3600 – Concrete Structures



NCC (National Construction Code)



We will guide you, but you must be technically capable.

Domain

Off-market opportunities

Budget range

Rental yield



Strategy fit



Basic red flags



Most properties will be rejected quickly.

Trello & Organisation

What We Are Looking For

Strong written English

Organised and reliable



Highly Preferred (But Not Required)



Experience with Australian real estate

title: Lead SEO Engineer & Web Developer (SaaS/Enterprise)
description:
We are seeking a high-level Lead SEO Engineer with a strong Web Development background to spearhead our organic growth. This is not a "content-only" SEO role; we need a technical powerhouse who has a proven track record of ranking SaaS,  18 DaaS, or Software companies on a national scale. 

You will be responsible for defining the strategy, managing the technical execution, and leading a team to ensure our software products dominate highly competitive search landscapes.   



Key Responsibilities:   

Strategic Leadership: Develop and execute end-to-end SEO Roadmaps for national SaaS/Software markets.   

Technical SEO & Dev: Perform deep technical audits and personally execute code-level fixes (HTML/CSS, JS, Schema, Site Speed Optimization).   



Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of specialists, ensuring KPIs are met and strategies are followed through to completion.   



Data-Driven Growth: Utilize advanced analytics to track national rankings, conversion rates, and ROI.   

Requirements:   

Experience: 5+ years of proven SEO experience specifically within the Software/SaaS/DaaS sectors.   

Technical Stack: Proficient in Web Development (Full-stack with WordPress or Headless ReactJS +WP) to bridge the gap between marketing and engineering.   



Must be able to demonstrate previous success ranking competitive keywords at a national level.   

We are looking for someone who is not shy, who knows how to communicate in from of the team, present strategies, 

Schedule: Must be available to work Full-Time during Central Standard Time (CST) business hours.   

Communication: Exceptional English communication skills for leadership and reporting.   



What We Offer:   

Steady, long-term full-time contract

A collaborative environment with room for high-level technical influence.   

Competitive compensation based on experience.

title: Social Media Video Editor
description:
We are hiring a full-time or part-time Video Editor to support daily short-form content for local business clients. Most edits will be between 10 seconds and 1 minute, created for social media platforms like Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts. The content includes promotional videos, talking head clips, and funny skits, and you should have strong pacing and storytelling skills, with solid Adobe Premiere Pro experience for fast, clean, consistent edits.



We are looking for someone with great communication skills who is easy-going, productive, and open to suggestions and feedback. You should be comfortable collaborating with a creative team, taking direction, and turning revisions around quickly while staying organized and on schedule. Experience with captions, sound design, and light motion graphics is a plus, but reliability, creativity, and a positive attitude matter most.

title: AI-Native Generalist
description:
The Role

I am looking for a high-speed, AI-native developer who specializes in "rapid execution." I don’t need someone to spend months on a single project; I need a technical partner who can take a random idea and turn it into a working reality in 48 to 72 hours.



You aren’t just a coder - you are an expert at leveraging the world’s best AI models to bypass traditional development timelines. If you can’t build it from scratch, you know exactly how to prompt an AI to help you build it, fix it, and ship it.



What You’ll Be Doing

I’m going to throw a constant stream of "sprint tasks" at you. You’ll be the person who makes things happen across a wide variety of platforms.



Projects include:



Web Ops: Building quick sites with functional backends.



Automations: Setting up content creation workflows, n8n/Make sequences, or custom scripts.



Bot Builds: Deploying 
/Telegram bots and integrating Claude or GPT-4o into custom tools.



General Tech Setup: Handling "anti-tasks"—the random technical hurdles that pop up and need to be solved now.



Who You Are

Highly Adaptable: You don’t have "one stack." You use whatever tool gets the job done fastest.



AI-Fluent: You use AI to 10x your output. If you aren't using the latest models to work faster, this isn't for you.



Speed-Obsessed: You thrive on variety and move fast. You prefer finishing three small projects a week over one big project a month.



Reliable: When I ask for a change or a new tool, you iterate quickly and keep the 
ntum going.



The Perks

Consistent Work: This is a long-term, ongoing role. As long as you deliver, I have projects for you.



Insider Access: You’ll get full access to the software I sell and the internal tools we use.



Future Growth: Perform well here, and you’ll be the first person I go to for the bigger opportunities and ventures coming down the line.

title: AI Artist / Graphic Designer
description:
ABOUT US



Earth Moon Magick is a spiritual indie brand house creating oracle and tarot decks, journals, and divination tools. Our products are designed to help people reconnect with themselves through symbolism, beauty, and emotional resonance. We’re a remote team and we collaborate with artists worldwide.



We’re currently looking for a high quality AI Illustrator to help us create full decks with consistent, soulful, dreamy visuals — and to grow with us long-term.



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Create full oracle/tarot decks (44–88 final images per deck), using a mix between AI and photoshop, etc.

- Adapt prompts + style based on our art direction, theme, and moodboard (and contribute ideas!!)

- Maintain stylistic consistency across a full deck (characters, lighting, palette, composition, symbols)

- Refine outputs using a combination of tools when needed (Midjourney + ChatGPT / “Nano Banana” / other workflows)

- Create mockups / 3D-like visuals for marketing, previews, and presentations (any method/tools you prefer)

- Collaborate with our creative team and accept feedback with professionalism + ease

- Support multiple deck projects per year (goal: **4+ projects/year**) once the collaboration is flowing



QUALIFICATIONS



Mandatory:

- Advanced Midjourney skills (prompting, style consistency, iteration, upscaling, variation control, etc.)

- Strong eye for art direction, composition, and storytelling

- Extremely creative and enthusiastic about this work

- Ability to consistently create images that feel mystical, feminine, dreamy, symbolic, and mature

- Ability to connect with a spiritually mature audience that appreciates soulful artistic storytelling.

- Excellent communication + reliability (meeting deadlines, updating progress, responding clearly)

- Comfortable showing your “behind the scenes” process (prompt evolution + iteration choices)



Preferred (nice to have):

- Experience creating cohesive series (decks, collections, character sets, story worlds)

- Familiarity with tarot/oracle symbolism and archetypes

- Mockup / graphic design experience (Photoshop, Canva, Figma, mockup tools, etc.)

- Ability to edit or enhance details post-generation (where needed)



EXPECTATIONS

(how good you need to be)



- You can hold one consistent visual universe across 50–80 images

- You understand that oracle/tarot art must carry emotion + meaning, not just look pretty

- You include the phrase “SILVER DOLPHIN” in the subject + top of your reply so we know you read the full description

- You can follow direction and problem-solve when something isn’t working

- You have the humility to ask questions when you don't know something

- You can iterate quickly while maintaining quality

- You communicate progress clearly (and collaborate along the way)



SALARY & HOURS



Starting at ~$600* USD/month (part-time, ongoing support + collaboration) (*salary can be adjusted, dependent on skill level). Opportunity for bonuses and pay advances depending on performance and growth within the company.



HOW TO APPLY



Please reply with:



1. Your Midjourney profile (or showcase link)

2. Your portfolio (ArtStation or external) featuring AI work

3. 2–5 examples of prompts you wrote (and what you were trying to achieve)

4. A short answer: What do you think makes AI art feel soulful instead of generic?

5. "SILVER DOLPHIN" in the subject line of your reply to us.

title: Video Editor for Spiritual Brand
description:
About Us



Earth Moon Magick is an independent publishing house devoted to creating oracle and tarot decks; and some other sacred tools that inspire self-discovery, creativity, and spiritual connection. We’re a small team of four. We are heart-centred and deeply value authenticity, integrity, and connection... and we’re expanding our team to help expand our impact!



Even though this is a part-time role, if it's a solid fit, it can quickly shift into a higher pay and full-time.



Role Overview: We’re looking for a video editor (ideally attuned to spirituality, intuition, and feminine storytelling) to create 5–10 short videos per week (15–30 sec each) for Meta ads and social platforms.



You’ll work closely with our creative director to turn raw footage, UGC, and product clips into emotionally charged, high-converting videos.



Your Mission: Transform simple visuals into magnetic, cinematic ads that make people feel the energy before they buy.



Your edits should embody:

~ Soft, sacred pacing: slow transitions, breath 
nts, light flares.

~ Luxury feel: macro details, shimmering foil, warm golden tones.

~ Emotional depth: storytelling that evokes remembrance, connection, beauty.



Responsibilities

~ Edit 3–10 short-form videos per week.

~ Adapt footage into multiple aspect ratios (1:1, 9:16, 16:9).

~ Add captions, music, and subtle sound design aligned with brand tone.

~ Follow brand video angles and guidelines.

~ Collaborate with creative team for new ad variations and A/B tests.



Potential Responsibilities  (a big plus if you have experience with these!)

~ Content Creation

~ Photography



Requirements

~ Strong experience with Meta or TikTok-style ad editing.

~ Portfolio showing emotionally driven storytelling (spiritual, luxury, or lifestyle brands preferred).

~ Fluent in English.

~ Organized, creative, and passionate about spirituality or conscious living.

~ Available for consistent weekly delivery and responsive communication.



Expectations:

- You communicate clearly and promptly with the internal team.

- You’re proactive—spotting potential issues before they escalate.

- You’re reliable, consistent, and eager to learn new systems and processes.

- You care about the energy you bring to the role and want to grow within a purpose-driven and professionally-driven company.

- To show that you’ve read this entire post, please include the word BACKPACK in your message subject line when you apply.



Nice-to-Haves

~ Interest in tarot, oracle, feminine embodiment, and visual storytelling.

~ Experience with After Effects, CapCut Pro, or Premiere Pro.

~ Eye for music selection and pacing.



Type: Part-Time (20 videos/month minimum, potential for full-time)

Pay Range: USD 400–700/month, depending on experience and speed

title: Short Term Rental Property Manager
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Assistant to support our property management operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in client and tenant management, maintenance coordination, and administrative tasks. Experience with short-term rentals is required, and mid-term and co-living rental experience is strongly preferred. Knowledge of property management software is required, especially in the short term rental space. 



This is a remote that requires 6 to 8 hours of work per day, with an opportunity for more pay, time and responsibilities depending on performance. We are aggressively looking to expand the business so there is opportunity for growth within the first year and beyond. This company is also heavily incentive-based, with multiple bonus programs based on project or task completion.



Key Responsibilities:

Guest Management:

- Handle tenant inquiries, lease agreements, and communication regarding property-related issues.

- Intimate knowledge of systems and processes relevant to short term rental management

- Track tenant payments, issues, and documentation.

- Assist with tenant screening, move-in/move-out processes, and lease renewals.

- Proactively anticipating needs of tenants and guests with a service and hospitality-driven mindset



Maintenance Management:

- Coordinate maintenance and repair requests, ensuring timely resolution of issues.

- Work with cleaners, vendors, and maintenance teams to ensure efficient service delivery.

- Maintain records of work orders and repairs.



Client Management:

- Maintain regular communication with property owners and potential clients.

- Provide updates on property performance, tenant issues, and upcoming lease renewals.

- Assist in the onboarding of new clients and tenants, ensuring smooth transitions and client satisfaction.

- Proactively anticipating needs of clients with a service and hospitality-driven mindset



Bookkeeping & Accounting (strongly preferred, but not required):

- Assist with rent collection, invoicing, and managing payments.

- Maintain financial records and assist in reconciling accounts as needed.

- Track expenses and provide regular updates to management regarding the financial status of properties.



General Administrative Tasks:

- Expert knowledge of AI tools strongly preferred

- Support and maintain systems and processes specific to short-term rental and mid-term rental management, including property management software, Airbnb, Furnished Finder and other platforms.

- Manage and organize documents, contracts, and property records.

- Schedule appointments and coordinate virtual property showings or inspections.

- Assist in drafting and responding to
s, phone calls, and other correspondence as needed.



Software Management:

- Utilize property management software tools to streamline operations and keep records up to date.



Digital Marketing (Preferred but Not Required):

- Support social media marketing efforts to build the brand, attract potential tenants and promote properties.

- Assist in crafting content and updating social media channels as needed.



Qualifications:

Experience:

- Proven experience in STR property management or real estate support roles required.

- Strong knowledge of property management software tools (e.g., GHL, 
, RentRedi, Hospitable, etc.) is strongly preferred.

- Experience in short-term, mid-term and co-living rentals is strongly preferred



Skills:

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills (strong English proficiency required).

- Technically savvy and comfortable learning and using new software tools.

- Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

- Ability to proactively identify challenges and find effective solutions.



Soft Skills:

- Extremely organized and detail-oriented.

- Ability to work independently and manage tasks without direct supervision.

- Ability to ask questions for guidance when necessary.

- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically.

- High level of professionalism and strong interpersonal skills.



Hours:



6 to 8 hours per day, with flexibility in scheduling based on needs. Opportunity to increase pay and time depending on performance.



Compensation:

- Competitive hourly rate based on experience

- Bonus commissions available for every successful client acquisition, tenant placement and other bonus incentives



How to Apply:

Please send your resume and a self-recorded video link answering the following questions. If you don't have experience for a particular answer, that's fine. Simply move on to the next question.



Describe one underperforming short-term rental you managed. What were the key metrics you reviewed, what changes did you make, and what were the results in the following weeks/months?



A guest messages at 9:45 PM saying the home isn’t clean. What is your immediate response, and what specific steps do you take in the next hour?



Share a time you sensed a guest was unhappy before they directly complained. What were the signs, and how did you handle it?



An owner says occupancy is down 12% in the last 2 months and blames management. How do you respond, and what data do you reference?



What is one system or process you built or significantly improved in an STR operation? What was the problem, what did you change, and what improved?



What PMS, channel managers, and pricing tools have you used? How do you set up a new property from start to fully operational inside a PMS?



What operational differences exist between short-term rentals and midterm or rent-by-the-room models? What changes in screening, policies, or systems?



If managing 20 properties, how do you structure your daily and weekly workflow to prevent dropped tasks?



If bookings are slow 21 days out, what steps do you take before lowering price?



Describe a situation where you escalated an issue to an owner. Why did you escalate instead of resolving it yourself?



What makes you stand out from other interested candidates?



Ask any questions you have about the role?

title: AI Artist / AI Illustrator
description:
ABOUT US



Earth Moon Magick is a spiritual indie brand house creating oracle and tarot decks, journals, and divination tools. Our products are designed to help people reconnect with themselves through symbolism, beauty, and emotional resonance. We’re a remote team and we collaborate with artists worldwide.



We’re currently looking for a high quality AI Illustrator to help us create full decks with consistent, soulful, dreamy visuals — and to grow with us long-term.



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Create full oracle/tarot decks (44–88 final images per deck), using a mix between AI and photoshop, etc.

- Adapt prompts + style based on our art direction, theme, and moodboard (and contribute ideas!!)

- Maintain stylistic consistency across a full deck (characters, lighting, palette, composition, symbols)

- Refine outputs using a combination of tools when needed (Midjourney + ChatGPT / “Nano Banana” / other workflows)

- Create mockups / 3D-like visuals for marketing, previews, and presentations (any method/tools you prefer)

- Collaborate with our creative team and accept feedback with professionalism + ease

- Support multiple deck projects per year (goal: 4+ projects/year) once the collaboration is flowing



QUALIFICATIONS



Mandatory:

- Advanced Midjourney skills (prompting, style consistency, iteration, upscaling, variation control, etc.)

- Strong eye for art direction, composition, and storytelling

- Extremely creative and enthusiastic about this work

- Ability to consistently create images that feel mystical, feminine, dreamy, symbolic, and mature

- Ability to connect with a spiritually mature audience that appreciates soulful artistic storytelling.

- Excellent communication + reliability (meeting deadlines, updating progress, responding clearly)

- Comfortable showing your “behind the scenes” process (prompt evolution + iteration choices)



Preferred (nice to have):

- Experience creating cohesive series (decks, collections, character sets, story worlds)

- Familiarity with tarot/oracle symbolism and archetypes

- Mockup / graphic design experience (Photoshop, Canva, Figma, mockup tools, etc.)

- Ability to edit or enhance details post-generation (where needed)



EXPECTATIONS

(how good you need to be)



- You can hold one consistent visual universe across 50–80 images

- You understand that oracle/tarot art must carry emotion + meaning, not just look pretty

- You include the phrase “SILVER DOLPHIN” in the subject + top of your reply so we know you read the full description

- You can follow direction and problem-solve when something isn’t working

- You have the humility to ask questions when you don't know something

- You can iterate quickly while maintaining quality

- You communicate progress clearly (and collaborate along the way)



SALARY & HOURS



Starting at ~$600* USD/month (part-time, ongoing support + collaboration) (*salary can be adjusted, dependent on skill level). Opportunity for bonuses and pay advances depending on performance and growth within the company.



HOW TO APPLY



Please reply with:



1. Your Midjourney profile (or showcase link)

2. Your portfolio (ArtStation or external) featuring AI work

3. 2–5 examples of prompts you wrote (and what you were trying to achieve)

4. A short answer: What do you think makes AI art feel soulful instead of generic?

5. "SILVER DOLPHIN" in the subject line of your reply to us.

title: Shopify Operations Virtual Assistant (Detail-Oriented, Long Term)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Shopify Operations Virtual Assistant to support daily store operations across multiple Shopify stores.



This is NOT a beginner role. We are looking for someone with previous Shopify experience and experience working as a Virtual Assistant.



You will be responsible for monitoring orders, updating operational sheets, coordinating with suppliers, and following structured SOPs.



We are a systems-driven company and attention to detail is extremely important.



IMPORTANT — PLEASE READ



If you send a standard copy-paste application, it will NOT be opened.

Applications without a video will be ignored.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



• Monitor Shopify orders and order statuses

• Communicate with suppliers

• Follow structured SOPs exactly

• Check open orders and delays

• Manage product data and size charts

REQUIREMENTS



• Previous experience as a Virtual Assistant

• Shopify experience (order management / operations)

• Able to follow SOPs

• Good written English

• Organized and reliable

• Comfortable with spreadsheets

• Long-term mindset



VIDEO REQUIREMENT



Please send a SHORT video (1-2 minutes) where you answer:



1 Who you are

2 Your VA experience

3 Your Shopify experience

4 Why you are a good fit for a detail-focused role



Applications without a video will NOT be reviewed.



WORK STYLE



We value reliability, precision, and clear communication.



WHY WORK WITH US



You will work with clear systems and long-term growth opportunities.



HOW TO APPLY



Start your application with the word SYSTEM so we know you read everything.



Send:



• Your video link

• Short written introduction

• Summary of Shopify experience

description:
About the Role

Kranis B.V. is looking for an experienced Senior Brand Manager (E-Commerce) to take full ownership of our D2C brand operations. This role is highly strategic and hands-on, with full responsibility for managing and scaling our e-commerce brands across all brand-related functions excluding marketplace/platform operations.



You will be responsible for driving brand growth for two of our D2C brands—Minismus and Matakumi—with a strong focus on Shopify performance, pricing strategy, merchandising, conversion rate optimization, SEO, paid media, and brand presence across digital channels.

 Ads and Google Ads

description:
Hello. I'm looking for an experienced Xero Bookkeeper / Finance Manager who can confidently manage multi-company bookkeeping and produce clean, structured monthly management reporting. The focus is on running a proper month-end process, keeping accounts accurate, and staying ahead of issues.



Details:

– £4–£6/hour

– Part-time

– Initially 2 days per week

– Flexible working hours

– Remote



What You’ll Do:

– Manage bookkeeping across 4 companies plus a holding company

– Perform weekly bank and credit card reconciliations

– Maintain accurate coding of transactions with complete documentation

– Process supplier invoices and categorise expenses correctly

– Reconcile VAT, loans, intercompany balances, and director loan accounts

– Prepare and submit quarterly VAT returns

– Liaise with accountants for a clean year-end handover

– Maintain strong Xero workflows (bank rules, automation, reporting structure)

– Produce a monthly reporting pack (P&L, balance sheet snapshot, cash position)

– Maintain property-level P&L reporting (R2R, Development, HMO models)



Good Fit If You:

– Have 3+ years of hands-on Xero experience

– Understand UK bookkeeping and VAT requirements

– Have experience producing management accounts and monthly reporting

– Are confident in handling reconciliations and balance sheet control

– Have worked across multiple companies

– Understand director loan accounts

– Are proactive and do not wait for deadlines



To Apply:

Send a short message with BOOKKEEPER and your years of Xero experience in the title.

title: Airbnb Pricing Strategist | £5–£7/hour | UK Hours
description:
Hello. I am looking for a performance-driven Airbnb Pricing Strategist who actively improves revenue.



This role focuses on daily revenue execution: reviewing occupancy, ADR, and booking pace, identifying underperforming properties, and implementing structured pricing adjustments that move numbers. 



Details:

– Full-time

– UK business hours

– Remote



What You’ll Do:

– Review occupancy, ADR, and booking pace daily/weekly; flag and fix underperforming properties

– Extract and compare data from PriceLabs and competitor listings; diagnose booking gaps

– Adjust pricing rules, overrides, minimum stays, LOS strategy, gap-filling logic, and seasonality pricing

– Analyse listing ranking and conversion; recommend improvements in titles, positioning, and structure

– Support structured reporting, KPI tracking, and performance dashboards (revenue work is a priority)



Good Fit If You:

– Think analytically and can clearly explain decisions using numbers

– Have strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

– Have experience working with marketplace or pricing data

– Understand short-term rental performance metrics (UK market knowledge preferred)

– Can show proven results improving occupancy, ADR, or revenue

– Work independently, identify issues proactively, and present findings clearly



Nice to Have: hands-on PriceLabs experience, experience managing UK-based STR portfolios, structured reporting background



To Apply:

Send a short message and include ORANGE in your title, along with the NUMBER OF YEARS you’ve worked in the short-term rental industry

title: Senior Shopify Catalog & Product Data Specialist
description:
This role is best suited for someone who genuinely enjoys working with structured data, catching mistakes others miss, and building clean Shopify catalogs with precision.



We’re a Canadian eCommerce agency working with luxury fashion and accessories brands across North America. Our clients trust us to manage structured, high-volume Shopify catalogs with precision and consistency.



This is not a basic data entry role.

We are hiring someone experienced in building and importing structured Shopify product data at scale.



Key Responsibilities



• Build and launch large product catalogs in Shopify from purchase orders, buy sheets, and vendor files

• Structure complex variants, SKUs, tags, collections, and metafields

• Create and clean Shopify import spreadsheets with accuracy

• Perform bulk edits, imports/exports, and catalog audits

• Maintain pricing, imagery, and variant logic

• Communicate proactively during PST working hours



Requirements



• Strong Shopify backend experience

• Advanced Google Sheets or Excel skills (formulas required)

• Experience managing large SKU counts

• Excellent attention to detail

• Strong English communication

• Fashion or retail experience preferred



Compensation



• 42,000 PHP per month ($1,000 CAD)

• Paid bi-weekly

• 40 hours per week

• 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM PST availability required

• Long-term role with growth potential





To Apply (Read Carefully)



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Please submit:

1. Cover letter + résumé

Include examples of Shopify catalog work and approximate SKU volume managed.



2. Completed Test Task (approx. 10–15 minutes):

Open this Google Sheet:



• One tab shows a Purchase Order

• One tab shows a draft import sheet (contains errors)

Create a NEW Google Sheet and rebuild the import correctly.

Share the link (Editor access enabled) and list the mistakes you found and corrected.



3. 1–2 minute video introduction (Google Drive or YouTube link) explaining:

• Your Shopify catalog experience

• Your spreadsheet skill level

• Why you’re a strong fit for a precision-focused role



We review every application manually. Incomplete submissions will not be considered.

title: Accountant/Bookkeeper for CFO Firm
description:
Are you a master at reconciling tough balance sheet accounts?

Do you know QuickBooks Online like the back of your hand?

Can you work East Coast hours, 9am–5pm, Monday through Friday?



If so, you may be a great fit and will enjoy working with us.



Read Before Applying

Working hours are non-negotiable: Monday–Friday through 2:00 PM PT / 5:00 PM ET

Resume link required (Google Drive or Dropbox)

This role requires real accrual-based accounting, not cash-basis categorization

If your experience does not include understanding balance sheet flow, this role is not a fit.



What You Must Already Have

Daily QuickBooks Online experience

Applied accrual accounting experience

Strong balance sheet reconciliation skills

Payroll journal entries (wages, taxes, accruals)

Monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

Clear understanding of COGS vs operating expenses

Experience supporting multiple clients in a firm environment

5+ years accounting or bookkeeping experience

Reliable, high-speed internet



The Role

We are a U.S.-based fractional CFO firm supporting service-based businesses.

This is a detail-driven accounting role supporting CFO review and decision-making. Accuracy matters more than speed. This is not a training position.



Core Responsibilities

Maintain clean, accrual-based books in QuickBooks Online

Perform monthly bank and credit card reconciliations

Record and review payroll journal entries

Maintain a clean, consistent chart of accounts

Proactively flag issues or unclear transactions

Prepare reliable financials for CFO review

Support month-end close and client deadlines



How to Apply



Submit:



A resume link (Google Drive or Dropbox)

Written confirmation that you can consistently work through 2:00 PM PT / 5:00 PM ET

Confirm you have at least 5 years US accounting experience 



Applications missing this info will not be reviewed.

title: Accountant with Australian experience / knowledge
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant to work for our team in Australia. The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with Australian taxation and statutory requirements, managing payroll, and overseeing debt collection processes.



This role requires strong technical knowledge of Australian accounting standards and tax regulations, along with excellent organisational and analytical skills.



Key Responsibilities



• Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards

• Prepare management reports, including profit & loss statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements

• Prepare and lodge Business Activity Statements (BAS) and Instalment Activity Statements (IAS)

• Manage and remit statutory obligations including:



o GST

o PAYG Withholding

o PAYG Instalments

o Superannuation Guarantee contributions

o Payroll Tax

o Fringe Benefits Tax (FBT)

• Ensure compliance with ATO and other regulatory requirements

• Manage Single Touch Payroll (STP) reporting

• Process and manage end-to-end payroll, ensuring accuracy and compliance

• Oversee accounts receivable and lead debt collection activities, including following up overdue accounts

• Perform bank and general ledger reconciliations

• Assist with budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis

• Support external auditors and liaise with tax advisors when required



Skills & Experience



• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting

• CPA or CA qualification (or working towards) preferred but not mandatory

• Minimum of 1 years’ experience in a similar accounting role in Australia

• Strong knowledge of Australian taxation laws and compliance requirements

• Experience preparing and lodging BAS

• Proficiency in accounting software , preferably MYOB, although we plan to move to XERO in the future

• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

• High level of accuracy and attention to detail

• Strong communication and problem-solving skills

• Ability to meet deadlines and manage competing priorities



What We Offer



• Competitive remuneration package including 13th month

• Supportive and collaborative work environment

• Opportunities for professional development and growth



You will be reporting to the CEO and will have external accounting advice and support from our external Tax accountant.

title: SEO Specialist (Singapore Market Focus – Home Improvement)
description:
Company Overview – 338aircon.sg



338aircon.sg is a Singapore-based air-conditioning service provider specializing in installation, servicing, repair, and maintenance for residential and commercial properties. Operating in Singapore’s highly competitive home improvement market, the company is focused on building strong organic visibility, dominating local search results, and ranking **Top 3 for high-intent home improvement keywords in Singapore**.



This is a long-term role for an SEO professional who deeply understands the Singapore market and can consistently deliver measurable organic growth.



---



Role Objective



Your primary goal is to rank our business in the Top 3 Google search results for priority Singapore home improvement and aircon-related keywords, driving qualified leads and sustainable organic traffic.



Only candidates with proven Singapore SEO experience will be considered.



---



Key Responsibilities



* Develop and execute SEO strategies **specifically targeting the Singapore market**

* Conduct **Singapore-focused keyword research** (local intent, service-based searches)

* Optimize website content, landing pages, and service pages for conversions

* Perform technical SEO audits and coordinate fixes with developers

* Build **high-quality, locally relevant backlinks** within the home improvement industry

* Manage and optimize **Google Search Console & Google Analytics**

* Optimize **Google Business Profile** for Singapore local SEO dominance

* Track rankings, traffic, and conversions; deliver **monthly performance reports**

* Recommend content strategies aligned with **Singapore search intent and buyer behavior**



---



Requirements (Strict)



* **Minimum 2–3 years proven SEO experience**

* **Direct, hands-on experience handling a Singapore-based company (REQUIRED)**

* Strong understanding of **local SEO in Singapore**

* Solid experience in **on-page, off-page, and technical SEO**

* Proficiency with SEO tools

* Ability to analyze data and translate it into **actionable strategies**

* Strong written English skills



---



Strong Advantages

* Experience in **home improvement, renovation, aircon, property, or service-based industries**

* Proven success ranking businesses in **competitive Singapore local markets**

* Familiarity with **Singapore consumer behavior and search patterns**

* Basic knowledge of **conversion rate optimization (CRO)**



---



Compensation



* **Competitive salary** (based on experience and results)

* **Long-term engagement** with performance-based growth opportunities



---



How to Apply



Please submit the following:



1. **Updated resume**

2. **Portfolio or case studies** of Singapore-based SEO projects

3. **Sample results** (ranking improvements, traffic growth, lead generation)

4. **Expected monthly salary (in PHP)**

5. A brief outline of your SEO strategy for a Singapore home improvement company aiming for Top 3 rankings



---



**Important Notice**

**Only applicants with verified Singapore market SEO experience will be considered.**



We are looking for a **results-driven SEO professional** ready to grow long-term with **338 Aircon SG** and our partner brands.

title: AI-DRIVEN ORGANIC CONTENT CREATOR (SMM)
description:
Company: Beauty Sleep Club



Role Type: Full-Time Contractor (Remote)



Objective: Scale organic reach to 1M+ monthly views and drive profitable acquisition through high-volume, AI-enhanced short-form video.



THE CORE MISSION



You are a Creator First. You will architect a viral presence by combining raw creative intuition with a cutting-edge AI stack. Your goal is to dominate the "Beauty Sleep Ritual" conversation by producing a massive volume of luxury-minimalist content that converts.



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)



Reach: Achieve and maintain 1,000,000+ views per month across TikTok and Instagram Reels.

Growth: Drive net positive follower growth of 500–2,000+ per month.

Volume: Maintain a strict daily output of 10 high-quality assets.

Sales: Generate consistent, trackable link clicks to our BOGO offer pages.



DAILY CONTENT TARGETS (70 PIECES PER WEEK)

To succeed in this role, you must utilize AI to hit the following daily output:



5x Reels / TikToks: High-reach viral hooks, educational sleep tips, and "Ritual" unboxings.

3x Carousels: Educational deep-dives and aesthetic mood boards designed for "Saves".

2x Image Posts: High-end, luxury-minimalist statics generated/enhanced via Higgsfield.



RESPONSIBILITIES



AI-Native Workflow: Use Higgsfield for premium static ads and motion assets.

Trend Hijacking: Use AI social listening to identify viral trends and "remix" them for Beauty Sleep Club within a 4-hour window.

Platform Mastery: Manage the full end-to-end process of scripting, filming, and AI-editing.

Scheduling: Use Metricool to schedule all 10 daily posts for peak engagement times in the US and AU markets.

Reporting: Track and report weekly on reach, engagement, and link-click conversion metrics.



REQUIRED SKILLS & TOOLS



The AI Stack: Mastery of Higgsfield, ChatGPT/Claude, and AI video editing (CapCut, Captions.ai, or similar).

The Social Stack: Expert-level knowledge of Metricool and Instagram/TikTok algorithms.

Creator Intuition: You know exactly why a video goes viral and how to replicate it.

Aesthetic Alignment: Ability to execute a Luxury Minimalist brand voice that justifies our premium price points.





HOW TO APPLY



Please submit your portfolio and a brief 60-second video explaining how you would use AI to scale Beauty Sleep Club to 1M views this month.

We are looking for a skilled WordPress Developer who specialises in Elementor Pro and works confidently with Hello Elementor or Astra Pro.



This is not just a build role. We want someone who understands that AI is rapidly changing web development and wants to stay ahead of the curve.



If you enjoy clean builds, structured systems, and working with a team that values growth, this could be a long term opportunity for you.



What You Will Be Doing Daily



- Your responsibilities will include:

- Sending a clear daily task report

- Converting PSD designs into WordPress using Elementor

- Modifying and improving existing themes

- Troubleshooting minor coding issues when required

- Adjusting and refining theme elements where needed



Minimum Experience Required



To qualify for this role, you must have at least 1 year of experience in:

- WordPress development

- HTML, CSS and basic PHP

- Photoshop or similar design software

- Experience with Elementor Pro is essential.



Who We Are Looking For



We need someone who:

- Learns quickly and adapts to new tools

- Pays close attention to detail

- Follows instructions precisely

- Communicates clearly in English

- Is proactive and solution focused



We value reliability and consistency. If you say you will do something, we expect it done well and on time.



Tools You Should Be Comfortable Using



You do not need to be an expert in all of these, but you must be familiar with most:

- Web research using Google and other search engines

- Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

- Google Docs, Sheets and Slides

- Gmail and other
 platforms

- Microsoft Teams, Zoom, Google Meet and similar communication tools

- Project management tools such as Trello



Why Join Us

We are serious about growth.



We invest in our team and provide free monthly learning from the start. We believe that if you improve your skills, our company improves too.



This role is designed for someone who wants long term stability, skill development and increasing responsibility over time.



If you also have experience with Adobe Suite or related tools, we can help you develop those skills further.



Work Details:

- Full time position

- Monday to Friday

- Australia time zone

- Flexible working hours



At least one hour overlap for tea
etings (not every day)



After your 6 month probation:

- 13th month pay

- Sick leave

- 1 vacation leave and 3 sick leaves

- We honour most Filipino holidays except All Saints and All Souls Day

- Salary is negotiable based on skill and experience.



How To Apply.



Use the subject line:

“I’m a creative web developer”



Include your portfolio and examples of Elementor sites you have built.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us, not just complete tasks.

title: Graphic Designer/Wordpress Website Builder
description:
Graphic Designer & Web Designer (Adobe + WordPress)



Location: Remote / Hybrid

Type: Part-Time / Full-Time / Contract (Customize as needed)



Position Overview



We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer with Web Design experience to join our team. This role requires strong visual design skills combined with hands-on experience building and maintaining websites using WordPress, Elementor, and Divi.



The ideal candidate understands branding, layout, typography, user experience, and knows how to translate ideas into polished digital and print designs.



Key Responsibilities



Graphic Design



* Create branded graphics for social media, websites, print materials, and marketing campaigns

* Design logos, brand elements, and visual identity systems

* Develop marketing assets including flyers, brochures, digital ads, and
 graphics

* Ensure consistency across all brand visuals

* Prepare files for print and digital production



Web Design & Development



* Design and build custom WordPress websites

* Work confidently with Elementor and Divi

* Customize themes and layouts to match brand identity

* Optimize websites for user experience and mobile responsiveness

* Update and maintain website content as needed

Required Skills & Experience



* Proficient in Adobe Illustrator

* Proficient in Adobe Photoshop

* Strong understanding of typography, color theory, and layout principles

* Experience building websites in WordPress

* Advanced working knowledge of Elementor

* Experience using Divi theme builder

* Understanding of responsive design and mobile optimization

* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines

Preferred (Nice to Have)

* Experience with branding strategy

* Understanding of SEO fundamentals

* Experience designing for service-based businesses

* Video editing or motion graphics experience (optional)



What We’re Looking For



* A designer who thinks strategically, not just visually

* Someone who understands how design supports marketing and growth

* A proactive communicator

How to Apply



Please submit:

* Portfolio showcasing graphic and web design projects

* 2–3 WordPress websites you’ve built (specify if Elementor or Divi)

* Brief description of your design process
