title: Kitchen & Interior Designer
description:
Hi — I’m the owner of a Bay Area design-build firm specializing in high-end kitchens and luxury residential remodels. I’m looking for a talented designer with a strong eye for composition, proportion, and materials — not just someone who can place cabinets.







This role is ideal for a designer who:







• Thinks like a designer, not a drafter



• Understands space planning, balance, and visual hierarchy



• Can translate inspiration into refined, buildable designs



• Is confident with kitchens, storage, and interior layouts



• Is highly detail-oriented and organized







What you’ll work on:



• Luxury kitchens & interior spaces



• Concept development & layout refinement



• Elevations, visuals, and presentation drawings



• Collaborative design iterations







Tools:



Experience with 2020 Design and 3CAD is important, but design ability matters far more than software speed.



Important:



I value creativity, taste, and problem-solving. This is not a production drafting role. Portfolio quality is the key factor.





If interested, please send:





• Portfolio (very important)



• Brief background / experience



• Software proficiency







Looking forward to seeing your work.

title: Graphic Designer.
description:
Overview



We are not looking for a traditional graphic designer.



We are looking for someone who understands how to build visual systems at scale using AI tools and can turn large volumes of AI-generated assets into cohesive, high-performing products and brand visuals.



This role sits between design, AI workflows, and production execution.



You will not be creating everything manually. You will be directing, refining, and systemizing AI-generated outputs so they look professional, consistent, and commercially effective.



This is a probationary role initially. We are looking for proven capability, not theory.



What You Will Actually Do



• Own visual consistency across products, marketing, and digital assets.

• Build reusable visual styles and frameworks that teams can follow.

• Improve AI-generated outputs through design judgment, prompting refinement, and layout decisions.

• Work with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney/SDXL/ComfyUI-style workflows, etc.).

• Guide teams on composition, brand alignment, and visual hierarchy.

• Convert raw AI outputs into polished, conversion-ready assets.

• Help scale production without sacrificing quality.



What This Role Is NOT



• Not a junior designer role.

• Not someone making random Canva graphics.

• Not someone who only knows traditional design software without AI workflow experience.

• Not someone who needs heavy direction.



Ideal Candidate Profile



• Strong visual taste and commercial design judgment.

• Experience working with AI-generated assets.

• Understands how to reduce visual drift and maintain consistency at scale.

• Can think in systems, not just single images.

• Comfortable working in fast, high-output environments.

• Bonus: motion/animation experience for short-form content.



How Success Will Be Measured



• Visual consistency improves across products and platforms.

• AI outputs require less rework.

• Product designs feel cohesive and brand-aligned.

• Teams move faster because design direction is clear.



Screening Questions (Required — No Exceptions)



1. What visual or production problem did you encounter in a real project?

Explain the problem clearly.



2. What did you personally do to fix it?

Describe your process, decisions, and tools used (especially AI tools if applicable).



3. Show the result.

Provide before/after examples or links and explain how your work improved outcomes (quality, consistency, speed, or performance).



Important



We are looking for builders and problem-solvers, not portfolio-only designers.



If you cannot clearly explain your thinking process and show measurable improvement from your work, this role is not a fit.

title: Senior Local SEO and Google Business Profile Specialist
description:
Full Time Career Role With Performance Incentives



We are not hiring a task worker.



We are hiring a performance driven Local SEO specialist who understands rankings, traffic, and conversions.



If you are confident in your SEO ability and want to work inside a growth focused environment, keep reading.



Who This Role Is For



Before we dive in, you can work 9 to 5 hours, not USA or UK times! 



This role is for someone who:

- Has proven Local SEO experience

- Understands Google Business Profile optimisation beyond basic posting

- Can analyse SERPs and explain ranking differences

- Thinks strategically, not just tactically

- Wants long term stability instead of freelance instability



If you are still learning the basics of SEO, this role is not for you.



What You Will Own



You will take responsibility for improving local rankings and visibility for real client campaigns. But you will receive support and training.



Your responsibilities will include:

- Advanced keyword research and search intent mapping

- Competitive SERP breakdown and ranking opportunity analysis

- Google Business Profile optimisation strategy

- Content gap and topical authority planning

- Backlink prospecting with quality evaluation

- Weekly SEO publishing with full on page optimisation

- Internal linking architecture

- Search Console performance analysis

- Google Analytics reporting insights

- Identifying conversion opportunities

- You will improve performance.



Minimum Requirements

You must:

- Have at least 3 to 5 years of hands on SEO experience

- Be able to explain how you improved rankings in a previous role

- Understand Local SEO ranking factors

- Know how to analyse competitors using SEO tools

- Be fluent in English



Experience with WordPress is required.



If you cannot confidently explain what affects local rankings, do not apply.



Tools and Technical Comfort



You should already be comfortable using:

- Google Search Console

- Google Analytics

- Google Business Profile

- SEO research tools

- Google Docs and Sheets

- Microsoft Office



Basic understanding of Tag Manager is preferred.



What You Get In Return

- Full time stability

- Philippine working hours

- Structured KPIs

- Performance bonuses

- Profit share potential

- Ongoing SEO training

- Exposure to real campaigns, not theory

- Sick leave

- One day off monthly

- Weekly training 



This is a long term position for someone who wants to grow into a senior SEO strategist.



How To Apply

At the very top of your message, write:



“I love SEO”



We are looking for someone serious about SEO, not someone looking for side work.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative & Data Operations Assistant (Renewable Energy Projects)



Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Schedule Requirement: Must be willing to work during U.S. Mountain Time (MT) business hours



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative & Data Operations Assistant to support our renewable energy development team. This role is primarily administrative and operational, focused on coordinating data, preparing documentation, conducting research, and supporting internal workflows that help move projects forward.



This is a dynamic position where responsibilities may vary depending on project timelines and business demand. The selected candidate will also provide administrative support to specific projects and teams as needed.



Key Responsibilities



The role includes, but is not limited to, the following administrative and coordination tasks:



1. Land & Parcel Research Support



Collect and organize parcel information provided by outreach teams.

Research property details using tools such as Regrid, LandGlide, and County Assessor websites.

Verify ownership, acreage, and location information.

Maintain accurate records in internal databases (TerraVault and CRM platforms).

Coordinate GIS requests for mapping and site evaluation.



2. Data Management & System Updates



Upload, validate, and maintain project data across internal systems.

Clean and prepare datasets for bulk uploads.

Organize parcel groupings and ensure proper project classification.

Ensure records remain structured, accurate, and up to date.



3. Proposal & Documentation Coordination



Prepare proposal-related documentation based on project team instructions.

Update financial inputs and generate summaries for review.

Coordinate document workflows between internal systems and document platforms.

Assist with revisions and finalization of proposal packages.



4. Administrative Support for Landowner Engagement



Prepare digital and physical proposal packets.

Coordinate mailing requests and logistics when required.

Track consultation bookings and update internal records.

Ensure documents align with requested terms and project updates.



5. Market & Land Comparable Research



Conduct research using platforms such as Zillow, Redfin, Lands of America, Land and Farm, and AcreValue.

Compile comparison data and summarize findings for internal review.



6. Campaign & Project Data Uploading



Support outreach and mailing campaigns by reviewing and uploading datasets.

Validate data prior to import to maintain quality control.

Assist in onboarding new project targets into company systems.



7. Cross-Functional & Project-Based Administrative Support



Provide administrative assistance to internal teams for specific projects as needed.

Coordinate with GIS, Outreach, Projects, and Leadership teams to ensure workflow progress.



Track tasks, follow-ups, and documentation to help projects stay on schedule.





**Nature of the Role



This is not a routine clerical role. The position requires:

Managing structured processes while adapting to changing business needs.

Supporting multiple teams depending on active projects.

Handling a mix of research, coordination, documentation, and system updates.

Being flexible and responsive as priorities shift.



**Qualifications



At least 2 years of experience in an administrative, data support, operations, or similar role.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities.

Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and online research tools.

Strong written communication and documentation abilities.

Self-directed and able to work remotely with minimal supervision.

Highly willing and able to work during U.S. Mountain Time hours (required).



**Preferred (but not required):



Experience in real estate, land research, GIS coordination, or renewable energy.

Familiarity with CRM or database systems.

Experience supporting project-based teams.



IMPORTANT:



Application Instructions (Important)

To apply, please complete the following steps:



1. Click the Google Form link provided in this job post and complete the application form.


/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq1I6o7JPiy-ds_KtkbznAcTENzQd_XTHHQBUsmASrWD7qpA/viewform?usp=dialog



2. After submitting the form, send a message through this platform using the format below:



Format:

[Position Applying For] – [Full Name] – [Application Date]



Example:

Administrative Assistant – Steve Jone – February 18, 2026



**Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be reviewed.**



Only shortlisted will be contacted.

title: Operations & Account Manager (U.S. Security – 24/7 Leadership Role)
description:
Operations & Account Manager (U.S. Security – 24/7 Leadership Role)

Remote (Philippines) | Full-Time | 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST + On-Call



We operate a 24/7 U.S.-based security services company managing 50+ field employees. We are hiring a leader, not an assistant.



You will own scheduling, coverage control, client communication, and operational stability. If coverage breaks, you fix it. If a client escalates, you take control. If a guard becomes unstable, you address it.



This role requires real operations leadership.



Core Responsibilities

• Manage daily scheduling for 50+ U.S. field employees

• Prevent missed shifts and coverage gaps

• Handle call-offs, replacements, OT control, and shift adjustments

• Enforce SLA response times

• Communicate professionally with U.S. clients

• Maintain strict CRM documentation in GoHighLevel

• Coordinate with dispatch, HR, and finance

• Track attendance, performance issues, and guard stability



Required Experience (Strict)

• 3+ years in operations, dispatch, logistics, or 24/7 service environments

• Experience managing scheduling for 30+ field employees

• Experience handling call-offs and urgent coverage issues

• Experience using GoHighLevel (required)

• Experience with CRM/ticketing systems

• Basic HR experience (attendance, discipline, performance issues)

• Strong English communication (written + verbal)

• Comfortable making decisions without supervision



If you have not managed scheduling at scale, do not apply.



Schedule

• 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST

• Must be available for urgent operational matters after hours



Compensation

• $6–$10 USD/hour

• Performance-based raises

• Growth path into Senior Operations Lead



Application Requirements (Mandatory)

Submit ALL of the following:

 1. Resume (PDF)

 2. 2-minute video explaining your experience managing 30+ field staff

 3. 60-second voice recording confirming PST + on-call availability

 4. List of systems you’ve used (must include GoHighLevel)



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



We are hiring ownership, not task followers.

title: Long-Term Wedding Photo Editor (Lightroom + Photoshop) – Detail-Oriented & Deadline Driven
description:
My name is Kayla and I am a Wedding & Portrait Photographer looking for a reliable freelance photo editor to help bring my images to life with careful attention to style, detail, and consistency for a part of this year, next year and years to come ideally!



I currently have at least 4 weddings to edit between March and April, plus 20 weddings booked for this year from May - November with sessions scattered throughout the year. This is the work I have guaranteed right now, but as I book more sessions and weddings, they will be added onto a task board right away so that you can see well in advance what I'll need help with and when it would be due, which will give you plenty of time to plan your life and other editing jobs accordingly around that.



As a heads up, I use an Ai editing tool to help me with the base edit so that the editing process is as efficient as possible. This means you would receive a Lightroom catalog with the images partially or mostly edited, but I still need help getting them fully completed through cropping, straightening, brush work, spot removal / eliminating distractions exposure + temperature correction, etc. and ensuring the images match my signature style.



Since the Ai editing tool will be taking care of the base edit, this means that it will take you less time per image to finish the edit to the standard I'm looking for since there will already be a base edit applied. For this reason, I'm looking for someone who can fine tune these images for $0.12 CAD per image. There will also be Photoshop retouching needed on a case by case basis, which includes advanced object removal and head swaps (only on selected images) and comes at an additional pay at $0.12 CAD per image.



Here is what I need help with:



-Fine tuning/editing about
+ photos per wedding in Lightroom using a preset I work with

-Fine tuning/editing about 15-50+photos per session Lightroom using a preset I work with

-Using brush tool, graduated filters, cropping, straightening, and making sure the Al tool got the correct exposure and colour temperature (you will be trained on how I edit my photos)

- Object removal and head swaps using Photoshop on a case by case basis 



What I am NOT looking for:



*If you are disorganized or have difficulty with deadlines and structure, please do not apply. 

*If you can't take honest feedback well and can learn quickly from the feedback, please do not apply.

* If you have an unreliable internet connection, please do not apply.



What I'm looking for:

* Seeking a long-term, part-time seasonal role, with primary work between May - November. 

*Dedicated, Loyal, On-Time, Organized, Hits Deadlines, Detail Oriented, Creative, Quick Learner, strong in English

*Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow creative direction.

*Experienced in Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop.

*Someone who takes responsibility for the work they do and doesn't make excuses 

*Someone who prides themselves on being detail-oriented and creating consistent high quality results

*Someone who is EXCITED to edit wedding and couples photos full of emotion and beauty 

*Ideally someone who could support me with having a 5-7 day turnaround time for weddings and a 2-3 business day turnaround time for sessions.



If this sounds like you and you'd love to connect more about this opportunity, reply to this job post with the following: your WhatsApp number, your
, let me know if you have Photoshop / Lightroom, let me know if you have a strong internet connection, why you love editing photos for other photographers, if $0.12 CAD per image works for you, examples of edited work you enjoyed editing, and an inspirational quote that makes you happy,



As a heads up, I will only be responding to applicants that I will select for the interview process, so if you don't hear back fro
 by March 3rd, I've d
 to go in a different direction.



- Kayla

title: POWER BI - SQL Server - Full time role
description:
We are looking for a hands-on Power BI analyst with strong SQL Server experience, including queries, joins and views.

The data model has been normalized and this role is about execution of migration and consolidation of existing reports to the new data model.



NOTE this is NOT a part time role, it is FULL TIME.



The role focuses on maintaining and enhancing existing reports, working directly with structured SQL Server data and ensuring consistent, reliable delivery.

We need someone who can systematically work through a backlog of report updates, fix issues, improve performance, and close tasks quickly.



This is not a strategy role. It is a hands-on delivery role.



WHAT YOU’LL DO

description:

This is a part-time role for a detail-oriented, technically strong professional who can lead projects from concept to final delivery.

* Edit footage into dynamic, story-driven sequences, integrating rhythm, pacing, and music

* Deliver content across multiple formats and platforms, including broadcast-ready outputs

* Partner with producers to manage the full production lifecycle from raw footage to final delivery

* Ensure all work meets brand, creative, and technical standards

* Collaborate with creative teams and clients, integrating feedback efficiently

* Explore new tools and AI-assisted workflows to improve creative output

* Support creative leadership and contribute positively to studio culture



Must-Have Skills & Experience



Core Tools

* Adobe After Effects – motion graphics, animation, compositing

Collaboration & Workflow

AI & Emerging Tools

Nice to Have

Who Will Thrive in This Role

* You are excited to experiment with new tools and AI workflows to elevate production quality

title: Accounting & Tax Virtual Assistant (Junior to Mid-Level, Australia-Focused)
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Accounting and Tax Virtual Assistant to support our team with Australian tax, compliance, and accounting tasks. We're seeking someone with a broader understanding of Australian accounting standards, BAS/IAS compliance, and business tax reporting.



This role is ideal for a junior to mid-level candidate who is comfortable working virtually, has strong proficiency in Xero, and is eager to grow their career in virtual accounting services with an Australian focus.



Core Competencies

- Hands-on experience in Australian accounting and tax

- Proficiency in Xero (Australian version); experience with QuickBooks or MYOB is a plus

- Ability to handle a variety of accounting tasks, including:

- BAS and IAS preparation and lodgement

- GST, PAYG, and Superannuation compliance

- Preparation of financial reports for businesses, trusts, or companies

- Familiarity with Division 7A, FBT, CGT, and PSI rules (a bonus, not a must)

- Support for business tax return preparation and small business tax strategies



Preferred Qualifications

- CPA certification or working towards CPA is preferred but not essential

- 1–4 years of experience in an Australian accounting role

- Prior experience working remotely or in a virtual assistant capacity is a plus

- Technical Skills

- Strong knowledge of Xero, including:

- Tax code setup and reconciliation (GST, GST-free, input-taxed)

- BAS/IAS preparation and submission through ATO Portal

- Payroll processing in compliance with STP and Superannuation

- Ability to generate and interpret financial statements and management reports

- Skilled in using Excel or Google Sheets for tax tracking, analysis, and reconciliations

- Familiarity with tools like TaxCalc, Business Fitness Workpapers, and ATO online services



What You'll Do

- Support and work with accountants with day-to-day tasks relating to Australian tax compliance

- Assist in the preparation of business activity statements (BAS), payroll, and reconciliations

- Manage financial records with attention to accuracy and ATO compliance

- Help prepare documentation for year-end tax returns and reports

- Maintain clear communication and reliable task tracking in a remote setting



This is a long-term, remote opportunity for someone who is ready to move beyond data entry and basic bookkeeping and gain deeper experience in Australian tax and financial support. You’ll work alongside experienced accountants and be part of a collaborative team. Apply now if you're detail-driven, tech-savvy, and committed to helping businesses meet their compliance and financial goals.

 the role you are applying for.

title: Business Assistant
description:
You don't want just any job. You want work that actually uses your brain.

You're the person who notices the gap before anyone else does. Who finishes a task and quietly thinks about how the process could have been smoother. Who finds a system that works — and then makes it better.

If that sounds familiar, keep reading.



About Us

Private Practice Alliance is an online business management firm that supports practitioners — particularly allied health professionals — to build sustainable, well-structured businesses.

We believe that good systems create relief. That clear structures reduce overwhelm. And that the administrative and operational foundations of a business are what allow practitioners to stay in work they love, for the long term.

We're growing, and we're looking for someone who wants to grow with us.



The Role

This is a full-time assistant role reporting directly to the founder. You'll be working across the business — supporting operations, keeping projects moving, maintaining quality and consistency, and making sure the right things happen in the right order.

This isn't a passive role. You'll be expected to take ownership, anticipate needs, and flag problems before they become crises. You'll also work across platforms and tools — so comfort with technology isn't optional.

Some of what you'll be doing:

– Managing inboxes, scheduling, and day-to-day operations so the founder can stay in her zone of genius

– Keeping projects on track — deadlines met, nothing falling through the gaps

– Supporting content, marketing, and client-facing work with attention to brand quality

– Learning our systems, following our processes, and flagging when something isn't working

– Communicating clearly and professionally with tea
mbers and clients

– Picking up new tools and platforms quickly — and using them well



Who We're Looking For

You don't need to have worked in private practice before. But you do need to understand how administration, client journeys, and brand consistency work — and why they matter.

You're the right fit if you:

– Think in systems and processes, not just tasks

– Catch details others miss — and care that you do

– Communicate with clarity and professionalism

– Can manage competing priorities without dropping the ball

– Take feedback constructively and implement it quickly

– Are genuinely comfortable with technology and enjoy figuring out new tools

– Know how to hold a boundary, follow a process, and ask a good question

– Are calm under pressure — not because nothing bothers you, but because you've got structure

You're probably not the right fit if you need a lot of hand-holding, struggle with ambiguity, or are looking for a role where the expectations are low.



What You'll Get

– Full-time hours in a role that's genuinely interesting

– Work that contributes to something meaningful — better businesses create better lives for practitioners and their clients

– A founder who is direct, fair, and invested in your growth

– Real responsibility from day one — not busywork

– Exposure to the full picture of how an online business is run



How to Apply

If this sounds like you, we'd like to hear from you. Please respond to 
 25 March 26 with the following details:



Step #1: Record a video answering the question:

"If you were to jump/fall safely from a cliff, would you:

a) Fall with your back to the ground

b) Fall with your face to the ground

c) Dive in

d) Jump feet first



And why did you choose that answer?"



Step #2:
 it with the subject line: "I want to be a Virtual Admin."



We review applications as they come in and will be in touch if we'd like to move forward.

title: Website Creator
description:
I am looking to build a secure, membership-based digital platform from the ground up. The project requires full UX/UI design and development of a multi-portal system with scalable infrastructure.

Core Platform Requirements:

User Types / Portals:

• Candidate Portal

• Employer Portal

• Agency Portal

• Internal Admin Portal

Each portal should have separate permissions, dashboards, and controlled access to information.

Public Website (Marketing Pages):

Approx. 8–10 pages including:

• Homepage

• About

• How It Works (high-level overview)

• Membership Overview

• Candidate Information Page

• Employer Information Page

• Agency Information Page

• FAQ

• Contact



Authentication & Account Management:

• Secure login and account creation

• Role-based permissions

• Password reset functionality

•
 verification



Profile System:

The platform must support large-scale profile creation and management.



Requirements include:

• Structured profile builder (multi-step onboarding)

• Resume and document uploads

• Portfolio/media uploads

• Searchable structured fields

• Ability to support high volumes of profiles without performance degradation



Search & Discovery:

• Filter-based browsing interface

• Controlled visibility based on permissions

• Saved profiles / shortlist capability



Messaging & Communication:

• Secure internal messaging or inquiry functionality between approved users.



Payment & Membership:

• Secure subscription or membership payment portal.

• Integration with Stripe or equivalent PCI-compliant processor.

• Billing dashboard for users (plan management, invoices).



Security Requirements:

• HTTPS encryption across the entire platform.

• Role-based access controls.

• Secure file storage.

• Protection against unauthorized profile scraping or bulk downloads.

• Audit logging capability for administrative actions.



Admin Portal:

Administrative access should include:

• User approvals and account management

• Profile moderation/editing

• Messaging oversight capability

• Payment and membership monitoring

• Analytics overview (basic reporting)



Scalability:

The platform should be designed to support significant growth in user profiles and concurrent logins over time.

Deliverables Requested:

• UX/UI design.

• Development of all portals and dashboards.

• Mobile-responsive design.

• SEO-ready public pages.

• Deployment-ready build.

Please focus on creating a secure, scalable infrastructure suitable for a private membership network platform.

title: Zoho Specialist
description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a Zoho Specialist to overhaul our existing Zoho Helpdesk ecosystem. This isn't just about managing tickets; it’s about re-engineering our data architecture, deploying AI-driven automation via Zoho Zia, and leading a technical team of SQL specialists and RPA experts to create a world-class support infrastructure.



Key Responsibilities

- Zoho System Architecture: Audit and redesign the current Zoho Helpdesk data structures. You will work with our Junior SQL Developer to ensure data integrity and advanced reporting capabilities.

- AI Implementation: Lead the deployment of Zoho Zia agents to automate first-touch resolutions, sentiment analysis, and predictive tagging.

- Infrastructure Automation: Direct the creation of Microsoft Intune and PowerShell scripts via RPA to automate device enrollment and endpoint management.

- Team Leadership: Oversee a tier-2 support team. You will be responsible for setting the standards for helpdesk excellence and ensuring seamless escalation paths.

- Bilingual Integration: (Preferred) Standardize support workflows for a bilingual environment to expand our service reach.



Key Responsibilities

- Zoho System Architecture: Audit and redesign the current Zoho Helpdesk data structures. You will work with our Junior SQL Developer to ensure data integrity and advanced reporting capabilities.

- AI Implementation: Lead the deployment of Zoho Zia agents to automate first-touch resolutions, sentiment analysis, and predictive tagging.

- Infrastructure Automation: Direct the creation of Microsoft Intune and PowerShell scripts via RPA to automate device enrollment and endpoint management.

- Team Leadership: Oversee a tier-2 support team. You will be responsible for setting the standards for helpdesk excellence and ensuring seamless escalation paths.

- Bilingual Integration: (Preferred) Standardize support workflows for a bilingual environment to expand our service reach.



Technical Requirements

- Zoho Mastery: Expert-level knowledge of Zoho Desk, Zoho Analytics, and Zoho Flow.

- Data Savvy: Strong understanding of relational databases and SQL to guide data structure improvements.

- Automation Specialist: Proven experience with RPA, PowerShell, and Microsoft Intune for modern workplace management.

- Zia AI Expert: Hands-on experience training and deploying Zoho’s AI/ML features.

- Language: English (Required); Spanish or French (Highly Preferred).



Who You Are

- You don't just "fix" software; you build systems that scale.

- You can translate complex business needs into SQL schemas and automated workflows.

- You are a mentor who can lead Level 2 technicians and script-heavy engineers alike.

- Note: Must be willing to work flexible/off-hours for deployments.

title: ???? Hiring Video Editors (AI Voiceover + VSLs + Meta Ads)
description:
Here’s the rewritten version tailored for **100x Ecom Labs** instead of MNY Ventures:



---



# Senior DTC Video Editor – 100x Ecom Labs



**100x Ecom Labs** is building the next generation of high-performance e-commerce brands. We specialize in scaling DTC companies through cutting-edge creative strategy and direct-response video marketing. Our team has helped generate over 100M+ views and drive massive revenue growth across multiple brands — and we’re just getting started.



Now, we’re looking for a senior video editor who wants to help us define what the next era of DTC creative looks like.



We’re scaling the in-house team that builds and tests the playbooks. We don’t follow trends — we engineer them.



We’re looking for an exceptional **Senior Direct Response Video Editor** to join our high-performance marketing team. This is your opportunity to work directly with founders, collaborate with A-players, and create high-impact work that drives measurable revenue. Top performers will have opportunities to grow into leadership roles as we scale.



---



## YOUR MISSION



Your mission is to lead the production of high-converting short-form videos — quickly and at elite quality. You will consistently create on-brand, compliant, and performance-driven content based on proven frameworks designed to maximize reach, engagement, and conversions — ensuring 100x Ecom Labs remains at the forefront of DTC video marketing.



---



## RESPONSIBILITIES



* Produce approximately **10 high-quality short-form videos per day**, following preset scripts, frameworks, and brand styles.

* Improve your performance bonus by analyzing prior video metrics and optimizing for views, CTR, hooks, watch time, and conversions.

* Apply direct-response copywriting principles when reviewing and editing scripts.

* Operate with high autonomy, managing your daily workload efficiently without constant check-ins.

* Rapidly learn and adapt to new tools, AI platforms, and creative trends — often within 24 hours.

* Ensure every video meets strict quality standards and follows instructions precisely to minimize revisions.

* Maintain proactive communication with founders and leadership when needed.

* Help train and onboard future editors as we expand the team.



---



## OUR TECH STACK



**Video Editing:** CapCut Pro (preferred) or Adobe Premiere Pro

**Video Generation Tools:** HeyGen, Captions, Hedra, Veo 3, and emerging AI tools

**Image Creation Tools:** Krea, Midjourney, Flux Kontext Pro

**Voiceover Tool:** ElevenLabs

**Communication & Project Management:** 
 & Slack



---



## KPIs YOU WILL OWN



* **10 Videos Per Day** – Delivered each weekday by 7:00 PM ET

* **90% First-Pass Approval Rate** – At least 90% require zero revisions



---



## WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR



* Proven experience creating short-form direct-response videos for DTC brands

* Strong understanding of direct-response copywriting (especially for short-form)

* Professional video editing experience (CapCut Pro strongly preferred; Premiere Pro accepted)

* Experience with AI video tools (HeyGen, Captions, etc.) is a major plus

* Strong written and conversational English

* High-agency, autonomous operator who thrives without micromanagement

* Fast learner who is energized by evolving tools and trends

* Detail-oriented — you believe in getting it right the first time



---



## WHY JOIN 100x Ecom Labs



**Performance-Based Compensation**

Your upside grows with your performance. Viral videos that hit key metrics unlock meaningful bonuses tied directly to results.



**High Impact Work**

Your creative will drive campaigns seen by millions — and directly influence revenue outcomes.



**Founder Access**

Work closely with decision-makers and have a real voice in creative strategy.



**Ownership & Autonomy**

We measure output, not hours. Deliver results and manage your workflow your way.



**Growth Path**

High-performers can advance into Lead Editor or Creative Strategist roles as we scale.



**Results-Driven Flexibility**

Success is measured by production and performance. Meet the 7:00 PM ET daily deadline, attend the Monday 12:00 PM ET weekly call, and be responsive during our 9:00 AM–8:00 PM ET collaboration window.



**Fully Remote**

Work from anywhere.



---



## THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF



* You are a perfectionist who spends excessive time refining minor transitions or visual polish. Speed + performance > cosmetic perfection.

* You prefer highly collaborative, meeting-heavy environments. This is a heads-down, high-output role.

* You need predictable systems and stable workflows. Our environment evolves rapidly.

* You want to specialize in only one tool or skill. This role requires adaptability and generalist thinking.

* You see this as “just a job.” We’re building aggressively — and we want people obsessed with winning in DTC creative.



---



## HOW TO APPLY



If you’re an elite direct-response editor who wants to work with a fast-scaling DTC growth lab, operate with autonomy, and grow beyond your current role — we want to hear from you.



To stand out, answer all application questions thoroughly and clearly explain how your experience applies to this role.



Include the code word: **DetailsMatter** somewhere in your application. We will only review candidates who follow this instruction.



This is a fully remote opportunity.

title: Credentialing Associate – Remote
description:
Overview:

Join our innovative team as a Credentialing Associate. This role is essential in ensuring the accuracy and compliance of our healthcare provider credentials across various states. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are passionate about operational excellence, we invite you to apply and contribute to our growing organization.



Responsibilities:



Contracting and Credentialing Support:

• Assist in managing the credentialing processes for healthcare providers nationwide, ensuring adherence to accreditation and regulatory standards.

• Verify qualifications, education, and licensure of providers, maintaining an up-to-date credentials database.

• Support the maintenance of accurate provider files and documentation.

• Manage follow ups with providers and payers and ensure that all interactions are well documented.

• Assist in identifying contracting opportunities and contribute to payer negotiations.

• Aid in the documentation of file statuses, ensuring meticulous record-keeping.



Process Enhancement:

• Help enforce credentialing policies and recommend improvements to enhance operational efficiency.

• Collaborate effectively with internal teams to streamline information gathering and coordination.



Stakeholder Engagement:

• Foster positive relationships with healthcare providers, addressing inquiries and concerns related to credentialing.

• Serve as a responsive point of contact for providers and payers



Compensation and Benefits:

• Competitive salary

• Full-time position

• 15 PTO per calendar year



Application:

If you are ready to contribute to our mission and meet the qualifications outlined above, we encourage you to apply by answering this short survey:







We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how you can make an impact as part of our team.

title: Construction Estimator
description:
Construction Estimator will be responsible for preparing accurate and competitive cost estimates for a variety of projects. This role requires close coordination with project managers, architects, engineers, and subcontractors to ensure timely and precise bid submissions and budgeting.



Key Responsibilities:

• Research and prepare detailed, competitive cost estimates for construction projects.

• Define and clarify the scope of work based on project plans, specifications, and client requirements.

• Perform cost build-up, including pricing for labor, materials, equipment, and subcontractor work.

• Conduct thorough risk analysis and incorporate potential risk costs into estimates.

• Prepare and submit accurate bid proposals within deadlines.

• Identify labor, material, and time requirements for each project.

• Analyze and evaluate subcontractor and supplier offers to ensure cost-efficiency and compliance.

• Review and assess competing bids for scope accuracy, pricing, and qualifications.

• Ensure high levels of accuracy in cost estimating and pricing.

• Input and maintain cost data in the company’s estimating database for future reference and benchmarking.

• Maintain strict client confidentiality and handle sensitive project data with professionalism.

• Build and maintain strong working relationships with subcontractors, vendors, and suppliers.

• Prepare and manage the estimating schedule to align with project timelines and bid due dates.

• Review and interpret construction drawings, blueprints, and technical specifications.

• Select appropriate estimating metrics and benchmarks to ensure accurate and consistent estimates.

Qualifications:

• 3+ years of experience in construction estimating, preferably in both residential and commercial sectors.

• Strong understanding of construction materials, methods, and market pricing.

• Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.

• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently in a remote environment.

• Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field is a plus.

• Familiarity with New Jersey/New York building codes and local pricing trends is a must.

title: Intake Specialist/Case Manager
description:
About Us

Veterans Global Consulting is a mission-driven organization dedicated to helping U.S. veterans navigate the VA disability claims process with compassion, accuracy, and integrity. Our team serves as advocates and educators, ensuring every veteran understands their benefits, rights, and path toward healing.

________________________________________

Position Summary



We are seeking a Case Manager / Intake Specialist who brings both a heart for service and strong communication skills. The ideal candidate will have a teaching or healthcare background, or a degree in teaching, with the ability to explain complex processes clearly, guide clients through onboarding steps, and ensure every veteran feels supported from their first call through claim completion.

This position requires excellent attention to detail, empathy, and a proactive approach to client coordination and documentation.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities



• Serve as the first point of contact for veterans beginning their claim journey.

• Conduct structured intake interviews and verify completion of onboarding steps.

• Review and organize veteran documentation (questionnaires, decision letters, DBQs, medical records).

• Educate clients on the VA claims process, timelines, and next steps.

• Coordinate with the Prep and Strategy departments to ensure smooth case transition.

• Maintain accurate case notes and updates within the CRM system.

• Follow up with clients regarding document submissions, scheduling, and pending tasks.

• Support company initiatives to improve intake efficiency, client satisfaction, and communication flow.

________________________________________

Qualifications



• Preferred Background: Teaching, healthcare, social services, or case management.

• Degree in Teaching or Education strongly preferred.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.

• Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.

• Compassionate and patient demeanor when working with veterans and their families.

• Comfortable working in a structured, process-driven environment.

• Experience with CRMs (such as Dubsado, ClickUp, or similar) is a plus.

• Prior experience in VA claims, healthcare administration, or educational advising is highly valued.

________________________________________

Additional Requirements



• Must have access to a reliable personal computer with a stable internet connection.

• Must be available and visible on Zoom during designated work hours for meetings, client interactions, and team collaboration.

• Must be proficient in Google Workspace (Docs, Gmail, Calendar, Drive) and comfortable using cloud-based systems.

• Scheduled shifts are required; this is not a flexible-hours position.

• Must be available for occasional weekend overtime or training sessions as needed.

• Zoom visibility during your shift is a mandatory requirement.

________________________________________

Preferred Experience



• Background in healthcare (medical assistant, scheduler, insurance verifier, etc.)

• Experience with disability claims, legal intake, or insurance processing

• Experience working with veterans or military populations

________________________________________

Benefits

• Paid Time Off

• Structured, consistent scheduling

• Training and mentorship in VA claims and case management

• Growth opportunities within a mission-driven organization

________________________________________

To Apply



Please submit the following to 
 with the subject line:

“Case Manager / Intake Specialist – [Your Name]”



Include:

• Resume/CV

• Brief cover letter explaining your fit for this role

• Short video introduction (1–2 minutes) sharing a bit about yourself and your passion for helping veterans

title: Client Intake & Onboarding Specialist (Sales Background Preferred)
description:
Veterans Global Consulting is seeking a highly organized, tech-savvy, and personable Client Intake & Onboarding Specialist to guide veterans through our intake process. You’ll be the first point of contact for new clients helping them feel welcomed, supported, and confident as they begin their VA disability claim journey.



This is a hybrid role that combines sales-style follow-up, intake coordination, and client support, ideal for someone with a healthcare, claims, or insurance background.



Key Responsibilities

Client Intake & Scheduling



Reach out to new leads and referrals to introduce services and complete intake calls



Guide veterans through digital forms, questionnaires, and document uploads



Schedule medical evaluations and prepare clients for appointments



Case Documentation & Support



Collect and organize medical records, intake forms, and client responses



Ensure all documentation is complete, accurate, and properly filed



Assist with follow-ups to gather any missing information



Client Communication & Follow-Up



Explain the process and benefits of working with our firm



Follow up with potential clients and maintain regular contact throughout onboarding



Provide basic tech support for Zoom, telehealth links, and digital platforms



CRM & Administrative Tasks



Update CRM with case notes, client communication, and intake status



Track client progress and milestones in our case management system



Coordinate with internal staff to ensure timely handoffs and clean files



About You

Required Skills:



Excellent communication and interpersonal skills



High attention to detail and organization



Proficient in Google Workspace (Docs, Gmail, Calendar, Drive)



Comfortable working with cloud-based systems and CRMs



Preferred Backgrounds:



Healthcare (medical assistant, scheduler, insurance verifier, etc.)



Disability claims, legal intake, or insurance processing



Veteran services or experience working with military populations



To Apply

How to Apply (send below items to 



Resume/CV



A brief cover letter explaining your fit for this role



A short video introduction (1–2 mins) to share a bit about you and your interest in helping veterans



We’re proud to support veterans, and we’re looking for someone who brings both professionalism and compassion to every call. If that sounds like you, we’d love to meet you.

title: Zoho Specialist
description:
As a Zoho Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in implementing, customizing, and maintaining Zoho applications, ensuring they are fully aligned with the needs of our business. You will work closely with various departments to automate processes, optimize CRM functionalities, and provide training and support for end-users.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Zoho CRM Management: Customize and configure Zoho CRM to align with business processes, workflows, and reporting needs.

2. Application Integration: Implement and manage integrations between Zoho apps (Zoho CRM, Zoho Books, Zoho Desk, Zoho Projects, etc.) and third-party systems (e.g.,
 marketing platforms, and payment gateways).

3. Automation: Set up workflows, automation, and custom functions to streamline business processes and improve efficiency.

4. User Training & Support: Provide training to tea
mbers on Zoho functionalities, and offer ongoing support for troubleshooting and system optimization.

5. System Updates & Maintenance: Monitor Zoho system updates, ensure compatibility with existing features, and implement necessary changes.





Required Skills & Qualifications:



• Fluent or excellent proficiency in English for effective communication with international teams and clients.

• Proven experience as a Zoho Specialist, CRM Administrator, or similar role, ideally with hands-on expertise in Zoho CRM and its suite of applications.

• In-depth knowledge of Zoho’s tools, including Zoho CRM, Zoho Analytics, Zoho Desk, Zoho Projects, Zoho Books, and Zoho Flow.

• Ability to create custom reports and dashboards within Zoho.

• Excellent troubleshooting skills and attention to detail.

• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to train users and collaborate with cross-functional teams.



Why Join Us?



• Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team.

• Competitive salary and benefits package.



How to Apply:



Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining your experience with Zoho and why you would be a great fit for this role.

title: IA VA
description:
About the role

We run a growing e-commerce brand and we're looking for a sharp, proactive Virtual Assistant to join us long-term. This isn't a one-off gig — we want someone who sticks around, grows with us, and genuinely cares about the work.



Your job is simple in theory: take the time-consuming, repetitive tasks off our plate. In practice, that means being resourceful, autonomous, and — crucially — genuinely excited about AI tools. If you're already using ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney, or automation tools in your daily workflow, we want to hear from you.



Full SOPs are already written. We don't expect you to figure things out from scratch — we'll train you on our processes and give you all the context you need to hit the ground running.



What you'll do



Handle day-to-day e-commerce tasks (B-Roll editing, order management, photo editing...)

Use AI tools to speed up repetitive or content-heavy tasks (higgsfield, research, formatting, etc.)

Follow and improve existing SOPs — suggest optimizations when you spot them

Help with light content creation, copywriting, or data entry as needed

Communicate clearly and proactively about progress, blockers, and ideas





Who you are



Fluent in English — written and spoken, no exceptions

Genuinely interested in AI and already using it in your work

Detail-oriented, organized, and reliable — you do what you say you'll do

Comfortable working independently and following documented processes

Experience in e-commerce (Shopify, Amazon, etc.) is a strong plus

Familiar with tools like Notion, Slack, Google Workspace





What we offer



100% remote — work from wherever you are

Full onboarding: SOPs, training sessions, and ongoing support

A 1-month trial period to make sure it's a great fit on both sides

Long-term opportunity with room to take on more responsibility over time

A small, fast-moving team that values your input and initiative

title: Client Success Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,100 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

title: Sales Manager
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Sales Manager to lead and scale EVORETRO’s B2B distributor and retailer sales efforts, with a strong emphasis on retail partnerships and B2C-driven growth strategies. This role owns the end-to-end sales strategy across distributors, retailers, and direct-to-consumer–influenced channels, while managing and developing the sales team.

The Sales Manager will be responsible for driving revenue growth through retailer acquisition, promotional strategy, product bundling, and data-driven sales forecasting, while ensuring strong client relationships and operational excellence. The ideal candidate brings 3–5 years of sales experience, prior people-management exposure, and hands-on experience managing Shopify-based retail and wholesale environments.



Key Responsibilities:

Sales Strategy & Leadership

Own and execute the B2B sales strategy for distributors and retailers, with a strong understanding of B2C buying behavior and retail sell-through

Develop and manage retailer-focused sales strategies, including promotional calendars, product launches, and seasonal campaigns

Lead, coach, and manage the sales team, setting targets, monitoring performance, and driving accountability

Identify high-potential markets, retailers, and distributors across regions

Act as a senior point of contact for key retailer and distributor accounts

Drive structured outreach, follow-ups, and pipeline reviews to ensure consistent revenue growth

Business Development & Partnerships

Research, qualify, and onboard new retailers and distributors aligned with EVORETRO’s premium brand positioning

Lead negotiations covering pricing, payment terms, MOQs, promotional support, and merchandising agreements

Design and execute promotional strategies and product bundling initiatives to increase order value and sell-through

Present business cases, sales forecasts, and market demand insights to leadership

Represent EVORETRO at trade shows, conventions, and industry events (virtual or in-person)

Sales Operations & Team Management

Oversee sales operations across retailer and distributor channels, including:

Order accuracy and fulfillment coordination

Pricing and promotion compliance

Contract and commercial term alignment

Manage and optimize Shopify retail and wholesale sales channels, including retailer access, pricing tiers, and order workflows

Ensure CRM discipline and visibility across the sales team, including:

Lead and account status

Conversion rates

Forecasted revenue and pipeline health

Client & Account Management

Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key retailer and distributor partners

Serve as a trusted advisor to clients by understanding their sales goals, challenges, and merchandising needs

Ensure a high-quality partner experience from onboarding through ongoing account management

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with Product, Marketing, Finance, and Logistics teams to ensure:

Effective promotional execution and product bundling

Accurate pricing, margin, and cost alignment

Smooth order fulfillment and inventory planning

Share retailer and market feedback to support product development and pricing optimization

Performance Tracking, Forecasting & Analysis

Define, track, and report on key sales metrics, including:

Pipeline growth and velocity

Retailer and distributor conversion rates

Sales revenue, order volume, and average order value

Lead sales forecasting and performance analysis to support inventory planning and leadership decision-making

Deliver regular performance reports with insights, risks, and strategic recommendations

Continuously refine sales and promotional strategies based on data and results



Qualifications:

3–5 years of experience in B2B sales, retail sales, business development, or account management

Proven experience managing and leading a sales team

Strong background in retailer sales, with an understanding of B2C-driven growth strategies

Demonstrated success closing distributor, wholesaler, or retail partnerships

Experience managing Shopify-based retail and wholesale platforms

Strong negotiation, presentation, and client relationship management skills

Experience working with distributors, retailers, or international accounts

Familiarity with collectibles, trading cards, toys, or retail distribution is a strong advantage

Proficient in CRMs, spreadsheets, and productivity tools (Google Workspace, Excel)



Key Competencies:

Strategic, results-driven sales leadership

Strong sales strategy and promotional planning expertise

Product bundling and merchandising mindset

Excellent client and stakeholder management

Data-driven approach to forecasting and sales analysis

Highly organized with strong execution and follow-through

title: Case Manager – U.S. Law Firm
description:
Position Overview:



The Case Manager will be responsible for managing client information, coordinating communication, and ensuring that all case-related updates are accurately recorded. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and effective communication to maintain seamless client support.

• Exceptional communication skills for managing client interactions and follow-ups.

• Experience using Clio Manage and Clio Grow legal case management software is strongly preferred.

• Ability to manage multiple responsibilities while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.

title: Legal Intake Specialist (Personal Injury Law Firm)
description:
Customer Support Representative (After-Hours & Weekend Coverage)

Location: Remote – Philippines

Employment Type: Full-Time, Long-Term



We are hiring a reliable and professional Customer Support Representative to provide live, customer-facing support during our after-hours and weekends (PST).



Work Schedule (Required)

Evening & overnight shifts (after 5:00 PM PST)

Full weekend coverage required

Fixed schedule to be assigned



About the Role

We are a U.S.-based personal injury law firm seeking a reliable, professional Legal Intake Specialist to be the first point of contact for potential clients. This role is phone heavy and client facing. You will speak with people who have been injured in a motor vehicle collision and other claim event and help guide them calmly through the intake process.

This is not a generic VA role. We are looking for someone who communicates clearly, follows structured processes, documents accurately, and can work consistently during U.S. Pacific Time hours.

This is a long-term position with training, structure, and growth opportunities.



Key Responsibilities

Answer inbound phone calls and messages from potential clients

Handle high volume intake calls with empathy and professionalism

Calm distressed callers and guide conversations with clear call control

Collect and document accurate case details in our systems (CRM)

Confirm event details such as date, location, injuries, and next steps

Set expectations and explain what will happen after the call

Follow scripts and procedures while maintaining a natural, human tone

Work closely with the U.S. team during live PST business hours



Required Qualifications

Strong spoken English with a clear, professional phone voice

Experience in one or more of the following:

– Legal intake

– Call center or customer support

– Sales or client success

Comfortable speaking with injured or emotional callers

Strong attention to detail and accurate data entry

Reliable internet connection and quiet work environment

Ability to work the required PST schedule consistently

Preferred (Not Required)

Experience with CRMs or case management systems

Previous legal, medical, or insurance intake experience

Workstation Requirements

Stable high-speed internet

Quiet, private workspace

Quality headset and microphone

Computer capable of handling multiple web-based systems



VOICE SAMPLE REQUIRED (MANDATORY)

Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed.

You must submit a voice recording link with your application. The link must be accessible immediately (no permission requests).

Voice Recording Requirements

File format: MP3 or M4A

Total length: 60–120 seconds

Quiet environment, headset preferred

Label your file or link as: LAST NAME _First name _Intake Voice

Your voice recording must include TWO short clips:

Clip A – Self Introduction (25–40 seconds)

Introduce yourself and briefly explain your background. You may use this as a guide:

“Hi, my name is [Name]. I’m applying for the Legal Intake Specialist role. I have experience in customer support, sales, or intake. I’m comfortable handling phone calls, documenting information accurately, and working with structured processes. In client facing work, I focus on empathy, clarity, and guiding people through next steps.”

Clip B – Short Intake Scenario (45–75 seconds)

Respond as if you are speaking to a real caller.

Scenario:

A caller says, sounding stressed and upset:

“I was just in a motor vehicle crash. My neck hurts and my car is totaled. The other driver ran a red light. I don’t know what to do. I need a lawyer right now.”

Record how you would respond in the first minute of the call.

Your response should:

Acknowledge the caller’s stress or pain

Calm the caller and take polite control of the conversation

Begin gathering basic information conversationally

Confirm whether the caller has received or plans to receive medical treatment

Explain what the next step will be after the call

Do not give legal advice. Focus on intake, information gathering, and next steps only.

How to Apply

Please submit in one message:

1. Your resume (PDF)

2. Your voice recording link

3. Confirmation that you can work on the required PST schedule

We are looking for dependable professionals interested in long term work and growth. Qualified candidates will be contacted for next steps.

title: Paralegal (Litigation)
description:
About Us



Our firm is a client-centered personal injury firm committed to delivering exceptional legal representation with professionalism, compassion, and urgency. We handle a high volume of cases while maintaining a warm, supportive environment for both clients and tea
mbers. We are seeking a sharp, reliable Litigation Paralegal to support our attorneys from pre-suit through trial.



Position Summary



The Litigation Paralegal supports attorneys in all phases of litigation, with a primary focus on personal injury matters. This role requires strong organization, attention to detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Personal injury litigation experience is strongly preferred, and candidates with a legal background or legal degree/certification are encouraged to apply.



Key Responsibilities



Litigation Support

• Draft and file pleadings, motions, discovery, subpoenas, and correspondence.

• Assist with case strategy by organizing evidence, medical records, and damages documentation.

• Manage discovery process: propound/answer discovery, track deadlines, summarize responses, and follow up on deficiencies.

• Prepare trial notebooks, exhibit lists, witness files, deposition summaries, and mediation packages.

• Coordinate depositions, mediations, hearings, and trials, including court reporter and interpreter scheduling.



Case Management

• Maintain accurate case files (digital and physical), including indexing, scanning, and document control.

• Track statute of limitations, court deadlines, and internal milestones using firm calendaring systems.

• Communicate professionally with clients, medical providers, experts, opposing counsel, and court personnel.

• Request, review, and summarize medical records and billing; assist with lien tracking and resolution.

• Support attorneys in settlement demand preparation and negotiation documentation.



Administrative & Team Support

• Enter and maintain case notes in the case management system.

• Assist with incoming calls, client intake, and status updates as needed.

title: Affiliate Manager

Job Description:

We’re looking for a driven, organized, and relationship-focused Affiliate Manager to lead and scale our affiliate program across platforms like ShopMy, Levanta, and key influencer networks.

What You’ll Do

Key Responsibilities



Manage and optimize SRI Labs’ affiliate program across ShopMy, Levanta, and other affiliate platforms.

Collaborate with internal marketing, product, design, and operations teams to support affiliate needs.

Based in the Philippines

Experienced in affiliate, influencer marketing, or digital partnerships (1–3+ years preferred).

Organized, reliable, and able to manage many creators and campaigns at once.

Strong at relationship-building — someone affiliates love to work with.

Comfortable working within platforms like ShopMy, Levanta, Impact, or similar tools.

Data-driven with excellent follow-through and communication skills.

Hungry, proactive, and passionate about helping a brand grow.

Why Join SRI Labs?



Remote work

Work directly with a high-performing founding team

Competitive salary based on experience

Long-term growth potential within a fast-scaling ecommerce company

Supportive, positive culture built around speed, innovation, and passion for great products

Job Type: Full-time

title: E-commerce purchaser
description:
Amazon E-commerce Purchaser

About the Role:

We are looking for an experienced Amazon E-commerce Purchaser to join our company. This is not a general buying role; we need someone who understands the nuances of the Amazon marketplace, can navigate Seller Central, and knows how to identify profitable products that comply with Amazon’s strict selling policies.



Key Responsibilities

Amazon Sourcing: Identify profitable Online Arbitrage (OA) or Wholesale opportunities specifically for the Amazon US marketplace.



Deal Analysis: Use tools (Keepa, Tactical Arbitrage, etc.) to analyze sales rank, price history, and buy box rotation to ensure high-velocity turnover.



IP & Restriction Checking: Verify that products are not flagged for Intellectual Property (IP) complaints and that our account is "ungated" to sell them.



FBA Prep Coordination: Ensure that purchased products are sent to the correct prep centers and that all labeling requirements are met for FBA shipments.



Profitability Calculation: Calculate net profit after Amazon fees (FBA fees, referral fees, storage) and shipping costs.



Supplier Management: Onboard new wholesale vendors and maintain relationships to secure exclusive "buy lists."



Required Skills & Qualifications

Amazon Expert: Minimum 1-2 years of experience specifically in Amazon sourcing or procurement.



Software Proficiency: Deep experience with Keepa (reading charts is a must), Helium 10, InventoryLab, or Tactical Arbitrage.



Seller Central Knowledge: Comfortable checking for brand restrictions and monitoring "Account Health" related to sourcing.



Math Savvy: Strong understanding of ROI (Return on Investment) and Margin calculations.



Reliability: High-speed internet and a dedicated workspace to handle time-sensitive "drops" or limited-time deals.



We are looking for a long-term partner, not a freelancer.



Strict Technical Requirements

Keepa Mastery: You must be able to interpret advanced Keepa data (Buy Box rotation, offer count vs. price trends, and sub-category BSR drops).



Advanced Sourcing: Experience in Online Arbitrage (OA) and Wholesale. You must know how to find "hidden gems" that aren't on every common lead list.



Calculated Risk: Ability to calculate true Net Profit and ROI after accounting for FBA fees, inbound shipping, prep costs, and a 3% overhead buffer.



Brand & Category Knowledge: Deep understanding of IP complaints, brand gating, and how to use tools like SellerAmp or RevSeller to check eligibility instantly.



Your Daily Responsibilities

Source a minimum of 8 high-quality leads per day meeting our strict criteria (e.g., 30% ROI+, $5+ Profit, consistent sales).



Analyze competitor stock levels to predict when the Buy Box will shift.



Manage purchasing spreadsheets with 100?curacy.



Monitor "Price War" trends on current inventory and advise on re-order or liquidation.



?? MANDATORY: APPLICATION TEST QUESTIONS

To be considered, you must include the answers to these 3 questions in your application message:



The Keepa Test: If a Keepa chart shows a flat BSR line but the "New Offer Count" is dropping significantly, what does that usually indicate about the listing?



The Math Test: If a product sells for $45.00, your buy cost is $18.00, and total Amazon fees (Referral + FBA) are $12.50, what is the ROI%?



The Detail Test: What is the first name of the person you are addressing in this job post? (Hint: It’s in the contact section).



Applications without these three answers will be archived immediately.

title: Virtual Assistant (Part-Time) – Document & Compliance Focus
description:
We are looking for a meticulous and proactive Virtual Assistant to support a growing consulting practice. This role is best suited for someone who thrives in detail-driven environments, enjoys working extensively with documentation, and can confidently manage structured, form-based submissions.



A substantial portion of this position involves preparing, reviewing, and organizing official paperwork. Candidates with experience drafting, reviewing, or assembling government forms, regulatory filings, or compliance-related documents will be especially well positioned to succeed. The ideal applicant is process-oriented, highly accurate, and comfortable juggling multiple deadlines at once.



Core Responsibilities



- Prepare, review, and maintain a high volume of structured documents, applications, and form-based submissions.

- Track active matters, manage timelines, and proactively follow up on pending items.

- Compile and organize supporting documentation required for regulatory or compliance submissions.

- Maintain accurate internal logs, databases, and project trackers.

- Develop and refine internal workflows, checklists, and procedural guides.

- Conduct focused research on regulatory requirements, licensing procedures, and industry updates.

- Provide administrative and operational support to ensure projects move forward efficiently.



Qualifications



- Previous experience as a Virtual Assistant, Legal Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or in a comparable support role.

- Direct experience drafting, reviewing, or preparing government forms, regulatory filings, or other structured documentation.

- Exceptional attention to detail and strong written communication skills.

- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple assignments while meeting strict deadlines.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Excel), Google Workspace, and common remote collaboration platforms.

- Self-motivated, resourceful, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.



Schedule



This is a part-time role. Hours will fluctuate based on project demands but will generally range from 15–20 hours per week. Please apply only if you are seeking part-time work and are available to work during U.S. business hours.



To be considered, please submit:



- Your resume

title: Bookkeeper / Accountant Pacific Time Zone
description:
Job Title: Full-Time Bookkeeper / Accountant ( Pacific Time Zone Availability Required)



Company Overview:

This full-time role combines hands-on bookkeeping with accountant-level oversight and CFO-minded strategic support.



You will ensure books are accurate, CPA-ready, and provide actionable financial insights for decision-making. The role requires strong independence, professional judgment, and full accountability. Prior experience with US-based or multi-entity businesses is highly valued.



Important: Availability during Pacific Time Zone (PST/PDT) business hours is required for real-time collaboration, follow-ups, and alignment with US operations.



Key Responsibilities:



Daily and Operational Accounting:



Enter and code receipts, bills, checks, debits, and credits into QuickBooks Desktop (QBD) and Aspire (once implemented), with correct class, customer, and job classifications.

Perform daily reconciliations with vendor bills, statements, bank/credit card accounts for accuracy.

Manage full Accounts Payable (A/P) and Accounts Receivable (A/R): run reports, process payments per SOPs, handle credit memos and applications.

Organize and file receipts digitally.

Follow up promptly with personnel on incomplete or uncoded items.

Review, post, and reconcile bank/credit card transactions daily and monthly.

Manage clearing accounts, timing differences, owner distributions, and equity transactions.



Month-End and Financial Close:



Prepare and post journal entries (accruals, depreciation, reclassifications, corrections, equity adjustments).

Generate, review, and stand behind monthly financial statements (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet) – clean, consistent, and defensible.

Close books accurately within two weeks of month-end.

Maintain fixed asset and depreciation schedules per CPA.

Proactively identify, investigate, and correct errors or misclassifications.



Compliance, Controls, and Tax Support:



Implement and enforce robust accounting controls and review processes.

Keep books audit-ready, consistent month-over-month, and fully prepared for CPA/tax reviews.

Prepare data for tax compliance (sales tax, payroll tax, etc.) and support CPA with annual filings, year-end reviews, or inquiries.

Flag risks, inconsistencies, or structural issues early.



Strategic Financial Oversight and Advisory:



Oversee budgeting, forecasting, and tracking systems (including Google Sheets controls).

Reconcile QuickBooks with external tools (budget sheets, CRM, etc.) monthly and explain variances.

Deliver insights on cash flow, cost control, and operational decisions.

Recommend process, reporting, or structural improvements as businesses grow.

Act as go-to expert for financial questions, making informed judgment calls and explaining impacts clearly.



Additional:



Support smooth transition to Aspire software.

Collaborate across entities, prioritizing GLAD while giving equal attention to real estate.



Who We're Looking For:



A seasoned professional who is not just a bookkeeper, but thinks like an Accountant/CFO—not just a task executor. You own the financial function end-to-end with confidence.



Must-Have Qualifications:



Proven Accounting Manager with full book ownership.

Extensive hands-on QuickBooks Desktop expertise (reconciliations, journal entries, A/P-A/R, equity, CPA-ready financials).

Proficiency with Google Sheets for controls/reporting.

Experience in service-based, real estate, or multi-entity environments preferred.

Strong independent judgment, accountability, and proactive mindset.

Excellent English (written/verbal) for clear communication.

Philippines-based with reliable internet and back-up computers/generators



Preferred:



Familiarity with Aspire or similar industry software.

US client or multi-business experience.



Time Commitment and Compensation:



Full-time- Must align with Pacific Time Zone business hours for meetings, follow-ups, and real-time collaboration—typically 8 AM–5 PM PST/PDT availability required).

Outcomes-focused: accuracy, ownership, and timeliness 

Long-term role with growth potential as businesses expand.

Competitive monthly salary in PHP (please state your expected rate in your application).



What's Important to Us:



Accuracy + efficiency.

True ownership and proactive accountability.

Independent operation with sound judgment.

Month-to-month consistency.

Professional, clear communication.



How to Apply:



To show attention to detail, follow this format exactly. 



Subject Line: Full-Time Virtual Accountant / Controller Application – Your Full Name



 Body / Application (include all):



Brief video introduction (2–3 minutes max) covering:

Your Bookkeeper/Accountant/CFO-level experience.

Years hands-on with QuickBooks Desktop.

Types of companies/businesses you've managed finances for.

Resume (PDF).

Cover letter: Why you're ideal for this combined role, confirmation of Pacific Time Zone availability, and your expected monthly salary in PHP.



We look forward to hearing from strong candidates ready to own this important function!
