title: Executive V.A. Needed
description:
I am looking for an executive virtual assistant who is sharp, articulate, and highly self-sufficient. This is not an entry-level admin role.



If you learned virtual assistance by following step-by-step instructions and waiting to be told what to do, this is not for you. Your skills should be strong enough that you can manage tasks, projects, and priorities independently, anticipate needs, and solve problems without hand-holding.



You must be fluent in English, both written and verbal, and technologically savvy.



Working hours are Pacific Standard Time.

You must be on video during work hours, so a fast and reliable internet connection is required. We work in a virtual office environment, and real-time presence matters.



Responsibilities:



- Manage daily tasks, priorities, and projects

- Follow up on pending items and ensure nothing slips through the cracks

- Inbox management and written communication

- General coordination

- Assist with ad-hoc tasks and projects as they arise

- Be available to provide updates.

- Start your cover letter with "Operation Ascend". Because this will signal attention to detail.

- Proactively identify issues and resolve them before they become problems

- Act as a trusted extension of my day-to-day operations





IMPORTANT – Please don’t use AI in any step of the hiring process.

We want to see you — how you think, write, and communicate as a professional.



Please include your RESUME/CV, as well as a brief video introduction when applying. This will expedite the review process — in your favor.



We don’t need long cover letters. Short, concise, and to the point is better.



We expect excellence in everything we do. If you do not hold yourself to the same standards — or if you cannot handle blunt, straightforward feedback — this may not be the right role for you.

title: Elite SDR for Silicon Valley Tech Firm – High Commission (PH-based, US Hours)
description:
Want to be the SDR who actually makes US-level money, not just VA wages? At DEVGRU Networks, top performers can earn USD $3,000–$5,000+ per month (base + uncapped commissions) with the potential for five-figure bonuses on big deals. We’re a Silicon Valley–based networking firm selling into casinos, healthcare, ISPs, and large enterprises—and once prospects meet our technical CEO, our close rate is very high.

Only apply if you have near-flawless English, a clear neutral accent, and a proven track record of turning cold calls into booked meetings with US decision makers.



Who this role is NOT for

Please do NOT apply if:

* You have an accent that makes it hard for US Directors/VPs to understand you on the phone.

* You are not comfortable making 40–70 cold calls per day to US prospects.

* Your experience is mainly chat support, VA work, or non-B2B outbound.

* You cannot work US hours (night shift PH time) consistently.

* You want a job that is mostly fixed salary with little performance-based pay.

* You are looking for a temporary side gig, not a long-term, full-time role.



Who this role IS for

This role might be perfect for you if:

* You have excellent spoken and written English, with a neutral accent, and you’re confident talking to US executives.

* You have at least 1–2 years of B2B SDR / appointment-setting experience calling the US, UK, or AU.

* You know your numbers: calls/day, meetings/week, show rate, and you’ve consistently hit or exceeded targets.

* You’re excited by the idea of earning more from commissions than from base salary.

* You want to work directly with a very technical CEO and help close large, complex IT/networking deals.

* Long-term, you’d like the opportunity to lead and train other SDRs as we grow.



About DEVGRU Networks

 DEVGRU Networks is a fast-growing, US-based technology solutions provider focused on Juniper Networks, Mist Wi-Fi, data center, and AI-ready infrastructure. We work with ISPs, casinos, healthcare providers, large enterprises, and other organizations that need rock-solid networks and expert guidance.

 Our CEO, Mike, is a former Network Architect, Senior Manager, and Director based in Silicon Valley, along with some of our key engineers. We already support several large customers in Silicon Valley and across the US, and we’re growing quickly. Once prospects meet with Mike on Zoom, our close rates are very high—your mission is to get the right people onto those calls.

 We offer 13th month pay, year-end bonus, a two-week Christmas break, holidays, and flexible PTO in addition to an elite performance-based commission plan.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a Philippines-based Sales Development Representative (SDR) to own outbound prospecting into targeted account lists (provided by us), primarily in the United States.

This is a cold-calling and outbound role with support from LinkedIn Sales Navigator and
 automation tools. If you love talking to people, booking meetings, and being directly tied to revenue, you’ll love this role.



What You’ll Be Doing

Outbound calling (core of the role)

* Make daily outbound calls to IT decision makers (IT Directors, CIOs, Network Managers, owners) from our existing account lists.

* Have short, confident conversations that generate interest and book Zoo
etings with our CEO.

* Follow a proven call framework while still sounding human and natural.



LinkedIn &
 outreach

* Use LinkedIn Sales Navigator to send targeted outreach messages (from Mike’s account) to 40–50 contacts per day.

* Build and manage simple
 sequences to our account lists using tools like Yesware.

* Follow up on opens/replies and convert interest into booked meetings.



CRM & process

* Keep our CRM and spreadsheets accurate and up to date (contact details, activity, statuses).

* Track your daily/weekly activity (calls,
s, LinkedIn touches, meetings booked and held).

* Collaborate on improving scripts, sequences, and messaging based on what you’re seeing.



Marketing “nice to haves”

* Occasionally help draft short posts for LinkedIn,
, or Instagram (we’ll guide topics).

* Highlight wins, case studies, and customer quotes in simple social posts.



What Success Looks Like

After ramp-up (first 1–2 months), success looks like:

* 8–15+ qualified meetings held per month with IT decision makers.

* Meetings that Mike describes as “legit opportunities”, not just random chats.

* A growing pipeline of opportunities that turn into hardware, software, and services deals.



Top performers will have the chance to grow into a Sales Manager / SDR Team Lead role as we add more vendors (HPE, Palo Alto Networks, Arista, etc.) and hire additional SDRs.



Requirements

Must have:

* 1–2+ years of B2B outbound SDR / appointment-setting experience, ideally calling US, UK, or AU markets.

* Comfortable with cold calling and speaking to senior-level professionals.

* Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

* Experience using a CRM and at least one outbound/email tool (e.g., HubSpot, Pipedrive, Salesforce, Apollo, Yesware, etc.).

* Reliable internet connection, backup option (hotspot), and a quiet working environment suitable for calls.

* Willing and able to work US business hours (Pacific Time overlap).



Nice to have:

* Experience calling into IT / technology / SaaS / MSP environments.

* Familiarity with terms like firewalls, switches, Wi-Fi, data center, or cloud. (Full training available and included)

* Comfort using LinkedIn Sales Navigator.



Compensation

* Base salary: USD $1,000 per month

* Meeting bonus: $25 per qualified meeting held (with IT decision makers that meet our criteria)

* Deal commission: 2% of net profit on any deal that you originate (SDR-sourced) that closes

* Tens of thousands of dollars in free training 

* 13th month pay

* 2 week Christmas vacation

* Paid holidays

* Flexible PTO

There is NO CAP on commissions. If you help generate and close larger projects, your compensation will scale with it. This is a potential dream job with potential income of  2x-10x base.



How to Apply

Please apply with:

* Your CV

* Insert “SDR DEVGRU - [Your Name]” in subject line of
.

* A sample outbound
 you would send to an IT Director at a casino or healthcare company to book a meeting.

* BONUS POINTS: A short voice recording (1–2 minutes) introducing yourself as if you were calling an IT Director at a mid-sized company to set a meeting with your “technical founder.”

* Apply points indicate your level of interest for this role

title: Virtual Assistant - Project Manager
description:
Role Overview:



We’re looking for a highly reliable, proactive, and detail-oriented Project Manager to oversee web design, development, and marketing projects from planning to execution. You’ll coordinate between international clients, designers, developers, and marketers. Light hands-on website tasks, marketing support, and VA duties are also part of the role.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

Candidate must meet all the following:

- Highly Responsive during work hours via WhatsApp or Slack

- Deliver tasks on time; Communicates immediately if delays are expected

- Honest, Open, and Transparent in Communication

- Strong attention to detail

- Thinks logically and problem-solves independently (not task-blind execution)

- Comfortable disagreeing respectfully; tell me “no” and explain why when appropriate



Core Responsibilities:

Project Management

- Own and manage multiple projects across web design, development, and marketing

- Translate project goals and client requirements into clear tasks, timelines, and priorities

- Coordinate effectively between designers, developers, marketers, and clients

- Track progress, deadlines, and deliverables to ensure smooth execution

- Ensure outputs meet quality, performance, and brand standards

- Proactively identify risks, blockers, and scope creep, and recommend solutions

- Maintain clear, organized project documentation and regular status updates



Communication & Operations

- Excellent written and spoken English (C2 level)

- Comfortable with time tracking + screenshot tracking during work hours

- Highly computer-savvy (Google Docs, Sheets, Jira/Confluence, Slack, web tools, etc.)

- Familiar with using AI tools to boost productivity (preferred)

- Willing to handle research, data entry, and admin/VA tasks when required

- Hard-working, self-driven, and accountable

- Self-driven, accountable, and able to learn independently and solve problems

- Work schedule: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM



Technical Responsibilities:

The Project Manager will be responsible for:

- Managing end-to-end project execution for web design, development, and marketing project

- Creating and maintaining project plans, task boards, and documentation

- Assigning tasks to designers, developers, and marketers and tracking progress daily

- Reviewing work before client delivery (designs, websites, marketing assets)

- Coordinating revisions, feedback loops, and approvals between internal teams and clients

- Managing project timelines, priorities, and dependencies across multiple clients

- Ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget

- Monitoring workload and capacity of tea
mbers

- Maintaining organized records of:

- Project requirements

- Client communications

- Timelines and change requests

- Supporting process improvements to make workflows more efficient

- Using project management tools (Google Workspace, Slack, Jira/Confluence, 
, Asana, ClickUp, Trello etc.) to keep everything structured



Qualifications:

- 3+ years of experience in project management, digital agencies, web development teams, or marketing teams

- Proven experience managing end-to-end projects across web design, development, and digital marketing

- Strong understanding of digital workflows (web development, design, and marketing processes)

- Familiarity with basic web concepts (WordPress, Shopify, Wix, hosting, domains) to coordinate teams effectively

- Knowledge of UX/UI principles, SEO fundamentals, and website performance

- Experience using project management and documentation tools (Google Workspace, Slack, Jira/Confluence, 
, Asana, ClickUp, Trello, etc.)

- Strong organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills

- Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Detail-oriented, proactive, accountable, and self-driven



Nice-to-Have Skills:

- Experience coordinating digital marketing initiatives (SEO,
 campaigns, social media tracking)

- Basic familiarity with CRM and automation tools (Zapier, HubSpot, GoHighLevel)

- Awareness of web platforms (WordPress, Shopify, Wix) and UX/UI principles

- Comfortable reviewing designs, websites, or marketing assets for quality

- Experience with project management, collaboration, and productivity tools

- Ability to suggest workflow improvements and support team efficiency

- Experience handling virtual assistant tasks (research, data entry, documentation)



Technical Requirements:

- Stable and reliable internet connection

- Reliable laptop or desktop computer

- Backup plan for internet or power interruptions



What you get:

- Exposure to international projects

- Supportive, creative, and collaborative environment

- Growth-oriented team culture that values initiative and ownership

- Opportunities for skill development and upskilling (Consistent high performers may receive sponsored courses or training)



Compensation:

- Please include your expected monthly rate in USD



If you are interested in this position:

1. Complete the Google Form at

2. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted via
 to schedule a Google Meet interview

title: Manager for Creatives
description:
We're seeking a Manager for Creatives who can transform strategy into powerful visual storytelling and lead a high-performing creative team to produce exceptional marketing and brand assets.



Please note: The creative team you will manage is composed of two creatives — this role requires hands-on leadership, close collaboration, and the ability to guide a small but dynamic team.



The ideal candidate is a blend of creative visionary and strategic thinker — someone who brings artistic direction, operational excellence, and strong leadership to a fast-paced digital environment. Highly organized and proactive, you excel at balancing big-picture concepts with hands-on creative execution.



In this role, you will collaborate closely with executive leadership and take a key part in shaping the company’s brand identity, voice, and creative direction — driving innovation, elevating quality, and setting a standard for world-class creative output.



Schedule: Tuesday–Saturday | 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM MT (US Hours)



Job duties and responsibilities:



      - Lead, mentor, and manage a two-person creative team to produce high-quality designs and content aligned with brand 

         identity and business goals.



      - Produce original multimedia content with minimal supervision and strong creative judgment



      - Ensure all creative work supports marketing objectives and measurable results



      - Develop and analyze social media content and reports to support digital strategy



      - Utilize creative software such as Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, Canva, Final Cut Pro, and AI-based tools



      - Manage digital content through platforms like Metricool, Meta Business Suite, and other scheduling tools



      - Collaborate with leadership to refine creative direction and marketing concepts



      - Present and justify creative decisions to executive leadership



      - Stay updated on design, media, and tech trends



      - Manage creative operations, workflows, and timelines to ensure efficiency and excellence





Qualifications



      - 6+ years experience in creative leadership roles (e.g., Creative Manager, Art Director, Senior Designer)



      - Strong portfolio showcasing branding, content strategy, and multimedia design



      - Advanced skills in Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, Canva, and related tools



      - Familiarity with digital analytics & social scheduling platforms (Metricool, Meta Business Suite, etc.)



      - Excellent communication & presentation skills — ability to pitch and defend creative ideas



      - Highly organized, detail-oriented, proactive, and adaptable



      - Experience managing creative workflows and delegating tasks





If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:



         1. A link to your resume in PDF format. 



                 Your resume should include your contact details, a recent professional photo, and a summary of your work 

                 experience, emphasizing tasks relevant to this role.



           2. A screenshot of your PC specifications and internet speed, 



           3. Your WhatsApp number for easy communication. 



To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "CreativeLead" in the subject line of your
.



We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Customer Support Representative
description:
About Candle



Candle (
) is on a mission to end loneliness, starting by building the daily ritual for couples.



We’re a fast-growing consumer app designed to help couples feel closer through daily questions, interactive games, shared streaks, and meaningful 
nts. Whether you’re long-distance or living together, Candle helps you connect in just a few minutes a day.



In under 10 months, we’ve grown to 900,000+ users, surpassed $2M+ in annualized revenue, and maintained <8% monthly churn, all with a small, scrappy team. We’re about to cross 1 million users very soon.



---



About the Role



We’re hiring a Customer Support Representative (part-time, remote) to own and manage our customer inbox.



At this stage, the volume of user
s, subscription questions, streak issues, bug reports, and heartfelt messages has grown beyond what our small founding team can handle. We care deeply about every user and **we need someone who does too**.



You will be the frontline of Candle.



You will respond to users, resolve issues quickly and clearly, and make sure every interaction feels thoughtful and human. You will also help us identify patterns, bugs, and recurring confusion so we can improve the product.



This role is high ownership. You will help shape how we scale support at a company growing extremely fast.



---



Key Responsibilities



- Fully manage and organize our support inbox (subscription issues, streak restores, login problems, feature questions, etc.)

- Respond to customers quickly, clearly, and empathetically

- Handle sensitive conversations with care (relationship apps require emotional intelligence)

- Escalate bugs and edge cases to the product/engineering team

- Identify recurring patterns and propose improvements to reduce inbound volume

- Help build internal support docs and refine macros/templates

- Protect the Candle brand in every interaction



Requirements



- Flawless English proficiency (both written and spoken).

- Exceptional written communication skills with attention to detail.

- A fast learner who’s comfortable adapting to new tools and systems.

- Availability during US time zones to align with our customers.

- Prior experience in customer support, ideally using tools like Slack.



Benefits



- 15 days paid time off annually, plus extra paid day off on your birthday

- Be part of one of the fastest growing consumer subscription apps

- Work directly with the founders and a small, hungry team solving a real-world problem

- Opportunity to grow into a Customer Success Lead role as we scale

- A product with **real retention, real revenue, and real impact**

- Opportunities to travel for team offsites!



---



Interview Process



We’ve outlined our process below - we intend to move quickly, and ideally the interview process will take no longer than 2 weeks from application submission



- Submit Application

- Short Video interview answering 3 brief questions

- Online Case Study

- Final interview w/ live challenge



How to Apply



To apply for this role, PLEASE FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING GOOGLE FORM and we will get back to you: 



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: CONTENT RESEARCH EXPERT (CRE): $800 a month
description:
BENEFITS

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible time

- Salary: $800 a month

- Paid every two weeks via Wise. (direct to your bank account, almost no fees, no waiting for payday!)

- A young, supportive team that values your output without micromanagement

- Clear growth path with opportunities to expand your role

- Join our international team working with established content creators and brands

- Work with the latest AI tools and social media platforms



TASKS



TASK #1: Research and Curate Viral Content



- Research 30-50 viral short-form videos on Instagram Reels and TikTok

- Strategically select content ideas that will help specific clients go viral

- Organize all content ideas in the "Client Master Sheet"

- Copy/paste links to each content piece

- Create detailed instructions for content replication tailored to the client's abilities

- Think strategically about what will help each client succeed



TASK #3: Administrative Responsibilities

- Complete daily End-of-Day Reports (EOD)

- Attend multiple meetings with your manager each week

- Continuously improve content recommendations based on what works



REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience in content creation is a MUST

- Experience in content research and trend analysis

- Strong understanding of what makes content go viral

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts features

- Strategic thinking and attention to detail

- Ability to provide clear, actionable instructions

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

- 100% say-do ratio and commitment to deadlines



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Complete our application form and record a personal introduction:



Fill out the form: 
/to/QRoz4WLV



Note: Put "CRE" + [Your Name & Family Name] in the "Name" field in the form.



Record a 3-minute Loom video introducing yourself (instructions in form)



Important: Please provide genuine, personal responses (no AI-written answers). We want to get to know YOU!



ROUND 2: Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview.



MORE ABOUT US



We've been in the industry since 2019 and have worked with over 3000 clients. We currently receive around 80-100 new clients per month. We provide an "80% done-for-you content & monetization system" that helps creators go viral and turn views into income using short-form content, AI, and proven strategies.



MORE ABOUT US



- About Young Publisher:

REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience in content creation is a MUST

- Experience in content research and trend analysis

- Strong understanding of what makes content go viral

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts features

- Strategic thinking and attention to detail

- Ability to provide clear, actionable instructions

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

- 100% say-do ratio and commitment to deadlines



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Complete our application form and record a personal introduction:



Fill out the form: 
/to/QRoz4WLV



Note: Put "CRE" + [Your Name & Family Name] in the "Name" field in the form.

Important: Please provide genuine, personal responses (no AI-written answers). We want to get to know YOU!



ROUND 2: Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview.



MORE ABOUT US



We've been in the industry since 2019 and have worked with over 3000 clients. We currently receive around 80-100 new clients per month. We provide an "80% done-for-you content & monetization system" that helps creators go viral and turn views into income using short-form content, AI, and proven strategies.



MORE ABOUT US



- About Young Publisher:

title: Ecommerce Virtual Assistant
description:
We are developing a home decor store optimized for Google Shopping and actively testing a large number of products.



Your primary responsibility will be to upload products efficiently, accurately, and in a professional manner using our structured workflow.



This is not a branding or marketing position.

This is a role focused on execution.



If you are highly detail-focused and able to work quickly, you will thrive in this position.



Responsibilities



• Upload 8–15 products per day

• Create clean product pages in Shopify

• Use Nano Banana (AI image tool) to create 4–5 improved product images

• Rewrite product titles and descriptions (short, clean, not hype)

• Remove supplier branding or watermarks

• Follow a consistent product page structure



What You Will NOT Do



• No use of false urgency or misleading scarcity tactics

• No creation or use of fake reviews

• No unprofessional or deceptive visual edits

• No unsupported medical or health claims

• No low-quality or irrelevant product images



Our focus is clean, professional, and straightforward execution.



Product Image Rules



Each product must include:



• Clean product image

• Close-up detail

• Lifestyle image

• Benefit image (minimal text overlay)



All images must look:

• Branded

• High quality

• Not like AliExpress



You will use Nano Banana to improve competitor images and create better versions.



Product Page Structure



Each product page will include:



• Clean title (Brand + Keywords)

• Short intro paragraph

• 1–3 standard trust sections (same on all products)

• Related collection



Pay



$4–6/hour depending on experience.



If performance is strong, long term position available.



Requirements



• Experience with Shopify product uploads

• Experience with Kopy (importing app)

• Basic image editing knowledge

• Can follow instructions exactly

• Fast and detail-oriented

• Good English

title: Lead Manager / Appointment Setter (Real Estate Experience Required)
description:
Lead Manager / Appointment Setter (Real Estate Experience Required)



Part-Time | Remote



Schedule:

 • Monday–Friday, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM US Eastern Time

 • Occasional Saturday or Sunday shifts as needed, based on appointment and deal volume



Role Overview



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company looking for a Lead Manager / Appointment Setter to take ownership of lead follow-up and appointment quality.



This role sits at the front of our sales process. You will work new, old, and cold leads, qualify opportunities, and set high-quality in-person appointments for our acquisitions team.



Strong performers will earn more responsibility, higher pay, and long-term growth within the organization.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

 • Following up with inbound, old, and cold leads via phone and text

 • Asking structured questions to understand motivation, pricing expectations, and readiness

 • Determining whether a lead qualifies for an in-person appointment

 • Scheduling appointments that meet company standards

 • Managing lead follow-up inside the CRM

 • Keeping accurate notes and dispositions

 • Taking ownership of appointment quality and outcomes



Compensation & Growth Path

 • Hourly Pay: +\- $8.00 per hour (based on experience)

 • Performance Bonus:

 • $10 per signed contract that originates from your scheduled appointment

 • Pay Review: After 30 days based on appointment quality and consistency

 • Growth Opportunity:

 • Strong performers can grow into higher-level lead management, CRM ownership, or training support roles



Required Experience & Skills

 • Experience in real estate appointment setting, lead qualification, or a similar sales-focused role

 • Strong English communication (spoken and written)

 • Comfortable speaking with U.S.-based sellers

 • Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable following clear standards and being accountable for results

 • CRM experience 



Application – REQUIRED



To be considered, please include all of the following with your application. Incomplete submissions will not be reviewed.



•2–3 minute voice memo answering this question:

How would you tell the difference between a seller who is truly motivated and someone who is just open to getting an offer?

No scripts. Speak naturally like you would on a real call.

• A short screen video from speedtest.net showing your download speed, upload speed, and ping

Screenshots will not be reviewed.

• A short screen video showing your computer details, including:

– laptop or desktop

– operating system

– processor

– RAM

• A short video showing the headset or microphone you use for calls and confirming it’s what you normally work with.

• A short video (10–20 seconds is fine) showing your actual work setup and surrounding area.

• Written confirmation that you can consistently work 4:00–8:00 PM US Eastern, Monday–Friday, and that you understand weekend shifts are occasional and added only if needed based on weekly volume.

• Your current CV or resume attached.



Extra:

• A short call recording (1–2 minutes) where you’re qualifying a real estate lead (remove any personal information).

title: Marketing Manager
description:
We’re Hiring: Marketing Manager

, and content channels

Join us and help shape the future of Kimbrough Legal, PLLC — apply today!

title: GL Accountant (For Pooling)
description:
We are building a talent pool of experienced GL Accountants for potential client requirements, supporting entities in the United States, Australia, and Singapore.



This role is for pooling purposes only. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted as soon as matching client opportunities become available.



Job Overview

The GL Accountant will be responsible for managing general ledger activities, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and maintaining compliance with applicable accounting standards (US GAAP, with possible AU / SG exposure).



Key Responsibilities

Oversee and manage the general ledger process, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with US GAAP

Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes for assigned entities

Perform bank and balance sheet reconciliations, including provision accounts

Investigate and resolve discrepancies and variances

Prepare and review journal entries, including accruals, deferrals, depreciation, amortization, straight-line rent, amortization, and reclassifications

Ensure proper accounting treatment of fixed assets (capitalization, depreciation, impairment, and retirement)

Perform variance analysis and provide explanations for financial results

Manage multi-currency transactions, including foreign exchange gains and losses

Act as Point of Contact (POC) for assigned entities or subsidiaries

Communicate directly with AP, AR, auditors, and internal stakeholders

Support audit activities by preparing schedules and responding to auditor inquiries

Identify opportunities to improve and automate accounting processes

Support transition from 15-day close to 10-day close

Assist in documenting onboarding and accounting processes



Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

Strong understanding of US GAAP (required)

Minimum 3 years of relevant accounting experience

Experience with NetSuite or another large ERP system (required)

Advanced MS Excel skills

Hands-on experience with month-end close and reconciliations

Ability to multi-task, prioritize deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Team-oriented, professional, and positive attitude



Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting US, AU, or Singapore entities

Multi-entity and multi-currency accounting exposure

Audit support experience

CPA or equivalent certification



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

- Your application letter

- Unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

GLAcctPooling – YOUR FULL NAME



Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly capable Payroll Accounting Specialist to support accurate, timely, and compliant payroll operations for a global workforce. This role sits within the Finance team and partners closely with People, Accounting, and external vendors.



You will own end-to-end payroll processing, payroll accounting, reconciliations, audits, and reporting, while supporting select employee lifecycle activities through close collaboration with the People team.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong payroll and accounting mindset, excellent attention to detail, advanced Excel skills, and the ability to operate confidently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.



What You’ll Do

*Payroll Processing & Administration

Own end-to-end payroll processing for U.S. employees

Ensure payroll accuracy across earnings, deductions, taxes, benefits, equity, commissions, and one-time payments

Coordinate payroll calendars, cutoffs, off-cycle runs, and year-end payroll activities

Partner with payroll vendors and internal teams to resolve payroll issues and employee inquiries



*Payroll Accounting & Reconciliations

Prepare and review payroll journal entries in accordance with U.S. GAAP

Perform payroll balance sheet and expense reconciliations each pay period and month-end

Support payroll accruals, true-ups, and payroll-related estimates

Maintain payroll documentation to support audits and internal controls



*Compliance & Reporting

Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll tax requirements

Support payroll audits, benefits audits, and external financial audits

Assist with W-2, 1099, and other year-end payroll filings

Maintain accurate payroll records and supporting schedules



*Systems & Data Management

Administer payroll and HRIS systems, with a focus on data integrity and controls

Partner on system testing, implementations, and payroll process improvements

Maintain accurate employee data related to payroll, compensation, and benefits



*Cross-Functional People Support

Partner with the People team on onboarding, offboarding, and employee changes impacting payroll

Support benefits and leave programs as they relate to payroll processing and deductions

Assist with headcount reporting, budgeting support, and workforce analytics



*Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects

Build payroll reports and models using advanced Excel

Support special projects related to payroll transformation, system upgrades, and process standardization



Who You Are

A clear and professional communicator

Service-oriented and responsive to employee needs

Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through

Organized and comfortable managing recurring payroll deadlines

Proactive and effective working across Finance and People teams

Adaptable and confident in evolving environments



Required Education, Experience, and Skills

3–5+ years of experience in payroll processing and payroll accounting

Strong understanding of U.S. payroll, taxes, and wage compliance

Hands-on experience preparing payroll journal entries and reconciliations

Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, complex formulas)

Experience working with payroll systems and HRIS platforms (Rippling preferred)

Experience supporting audits and maintaining payroll controls

Ability to analyze payroll data and clearly explain variances



Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

Experience supporting multi-state and international payroll

Prior experience in a high-growth or startup environment

Familiarity with payroll treatment for benefits, equity, and commissions



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

*Your application letter

*An unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

PayrollAccounting – YOUR FULL NAME



!!! Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: Video Editor Needed - Documentary/Behind the Scenes Travel Video to Seoul, South Korea
description:
Hello! I've just made a profile based off my friends recommendation to use this website. 



I have looked, looked and looked some more for a video editor for my project but have found it very hard. I have so much footage and it is a long video, many video editors didn't understand what I wanted. 



Here is the brief (it is obvious that I used chatgpt for this brief because every other brief I wrote myself, nobody seemed to understand the vibe or atmosphere of a video I wanted to create):



Objective:

Create a polished travel vlog from my footage in Seoul that feels cinematic, immersive, and story-driven, similar in vibe to the reference video I shared (YouTube link at the bottom). I want the viewer to feel like they’re experiencing Seoul with me, rather than just watching random clips.



???? Overall Style & Tone

• Vibe: Authentic, warm, cinematic travel storytelling — a mix of visual montage and voiceover narration that feels reflective and personal.

• Editing Style: Smooth pacing — not too fast like a flashy/viral style, but engaging enough to keep interest (think visual rhythm matched to music, subtle mood changes throughout the video).

• Color Grading: Natural with slight warmth — enhance city lights, food scenes, nightlife, and candid 
nts without overly heavy filters.

• Transitions: Clean cuts, some soft dissolves or film-like transitions where appropriate for mood shifts.



???? Narrative Structure

1. Intro (0:00–0:15)

• Establishing shots of Seoul — city skyline, streets, markets, your arrival, etc.

• Overlay a short intro voiceover (e.g., “I lived in Seoul for three years and love the people here etc;/I’m here for my friend’s wedding…”) — set the tone for the story.

2. Story Progression

I want the video to feel like a journey with emotional beats:

Section Visuals Voiceover

Seeing friends Footage of meetups, greetings, city walks Reflective, personal memories

Eating & food scenes Shots of plates, eating, street food Voiceover about favourite meals

Partying / nightlife Club clips, street scenes Personal commentary about experiences

Daily life & exploration Temples, markets, streets, trains Relating thoughts and mood

• Only use my speaking footage as voiceover commentary, never as full on-camera talking segments.

• Align visuals to the rhythm and emotion of the voiceover — emotional, real, conversational.



???? Audio & Music

• Music: Ambient, chill beats that enhance atmosphere but don’t overpower voiceover.

• Voiceover: Clear, balanced — place emphasis transitions between scenes.

• Sound Design: Include ambient sounds when useful (street noise, laughter, music in the background) but keep clarity of the voiceover.



???? Pacing & Feel

• Have visual pacing match the emotion of each section — slower and immersive during reflective parts, slightly more kinetic during fun outings.

• Avoid hyper–fast jump cuts. Let 
nts breathe.



???? Reference Inspiration

Here’s the link to a video with the vibe I love:

???? YouTube Reference: 

(The storytelling cadence, emotional pacing, and seamless integration of voiceover with visuals is the style I want to emulate.)



If you're interested I can tell you more over a Zoom chat.

title: Brand & Marketing Manager (Part-Time, Hybrid)
description:
Brand & Marketing Manager (Part-Time, Hybrid)



Build a brand people feel. Drive growth you can measure.



You’re tired of “marketing activity” that looks good but doesn’t move the needle. At Shym Saunas, brand is a growth lever — and we’re looking for a Brand & Marketing Manager who knows how to pull it.



About Shym Saunas



Shym Saunas is a premium sauna brand built for people who value wellbeing, design, and meaningful time together — without compromise. We’re founder-led, fast-moving, and intentionally building something distinctive in the wellness space.



We care deeply about craft, clarity, and outcomes. We don’t do fluff. We do work that earns attention and converts trust into revenue. We’ve built strong product-market fit and demand — now we’re ready to professionalise brand and turn marketing into a scalable growth engine.



About the Role



Reporting directly to the Founder, this part-time (2 days/week), hybrid role owns the brand and marketing function end-to-end.



You are accountable for:



Clear brand positioning and messaging



Consistency across every customer touchpoint



Marketing execution that drives measurable commercial outcomes



This is a senior, hands-on role. You’ll think strategically, then get it done — working closely with founders and managing external partners to ensure marketing efforts translate into growth.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Brand Leadership & Accountability



Own and protect brand positioning, tone of voice, and visual identity



Act as the brand gatekeeper for all brand-facing assets



Translate founder vision into clear brand strategy and execution guidelines



Marketing Strategy & Execution



Build and deliver a rolling 90-day marketing plan aligned to revenue priorities



Own campaigns across website & eCommerce, social (organic & paid oversight),
, and partnerships



Brief, manage, and hold agencies and partners accountable to commercial outcomes — not just outputs



Content & Creative Direction



Set the content strategy and publishing cadence



Approve all copy, imagery, and video to ensure premium quality



Balance brand storytelling, education, and conversion



Performance & Optimisation



Define and track KPIs across brand, marketing, and revenue contribution



Review performance weekly and monthly; adjust based on data



Provide clear summaries to founders: what worked, what didn’t, and what changes next



Partnerships, PR & Growth



Identify and activate strategic partnerships with commercial intent



Oversee influencer and ambassador initiatives tied to revenue



Support PR and earned media with defined objectives



What Success Looks Like (First 6–12 Months)



Sharpened brand positioning and messaging across all channels



A consistent, premium brand experience at every customer touchpoint



A marketing system that reliably contributes to pipeline and revenue



What You’ll Bring



Advanced experience in brand strategy and positioning



Strong commercial acumen — you care about ROI, not vanity metrics



Confidence leading agencies and external partners



A sharp eye for content, storytelling, and quality control



The ability to operate autonomously in a scaling, founder-led business



Calm, structured problem-solving and ruthless prioritisation



Bonus: experience in premium consumer brands, lifestyle, wellness, or design-led products



Why Join Shym Saunas



Direct access to the Founder and real decision-making authority



The chance to shape a premium brand at a critical growth stage



Flexibility: part-time, hybrid, senior impact without full-time burnout



A business that values clarity, quality, and outcomes over noise



Ready to Build Something That Matters?



If you want ownership, influence, and the opportunity to turn brand into a true growth engine, we’d love to hear from you.

 your CV and a 2-minute video introduction (tell us why this role fits you and how you’d create impact in your first 90 days) to:

title: SEO Specialist
description:
Role Overview

This role owns local SEO execution, reporting, and select client communication for our home-service focused agency in a self-managed role.



The SEO Specialist is responsible for creating and optimizing content, managing on-page and local SEO, handling basic website updates, delivering clear performance reporting, and communicating directly with clients on content approvals and updates. This role requires strong independent execution, accountability, and clear communication.

SEO & Content Execution

- Independently plan, create, optimize, and publish SEO-driven content including blogs, service pages, and location pages



- Execute on-page SEO improvements across title tags, meta descriptions, headings, internal linking, content enhancements, technical fixes



- Optimize existing pages to improve rankings, traffic, and conversions by identifying and implementing SEO opportunities without step-by-step guidance



- Own Google Business Profile (GBP) management, including ongoing optimization using SEO best practices



- Monitor GBP performance and apply optimizations to improve visibility and engagement

- Support light administrative tasks related to reporting and client management via
, Asana, and Google Drive



Required Skills & Experience

- Proven experience owning SEO and local SEO execution independently



- Strong SEO content creation and on-page optimization experience



- Hands-on experience with SEMRush or Ahrefs, Local Dominator or Local Falcon, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Ads, LSA, and GBP insights



- Experience working in Webflow and WordPress



- Strong problem-solving and communication skills with a self-starter mindset



How This Role Will Be Measured

- SEO content and optimizations are delivered consistently and on schedule

- Weekly Google Ads and monthly KPI reports are accurate, clear, and on time

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: JOB POST: Hybrid Admin VA & Appointment Setter
description:
Position: Virtual Assistant / Appointment Setter (Part-Time)

Company: LeadForge

Location: Remote

Compensation: [$
/month]



About Us



LeadForge is a lead generation agency serving high-ticket home renovation contractors in Canada. We help our clients fill their calendar with qualified homeowners ready to invest in premium renovations. We're growing fast and need a sharp, reliable tea
mber who can wear two hats: keeping our operations running smoothly AND being the first voice a lead hears when they come in.



The Role



You'll be responsible for two core functions:



1. Speed-to-Lead Appointment Setting: When a lead comes in, you're on it within minutes. You call, you qualify, you book. No delays. No excuses. Our clients' revenue depends on how fast and effectively you connect with leads.



2. Admin & Booking Validation: You'll manage the back-end of our booking system, ensuring appointments are properly passed to client platforms, confirmed, and organized. You'll handle rescheduling, cancellations, and keep everything tight so nothing falls through the cracks.



What You'll Do Daily



APPOINTMENT SETTING (roughly 60% of your time):

~ Call, text, and follow up with inbound leads within 1 to 5 minutes of them coming in

~ Qualify leads using our proven script (we train you on this)

~ Book qualified appointments directly onto our clients' calendars

~ Follow a structured cadence for leads who don't answer on the first attempt

~ Hit daily dial targets and booking KPIs



ADMIN & BOOKING VALIDATION (roughly 40% of your time):

~ Transfer/pass appointments between our booking platform and client CRMs where needed

~ Confirm all upcoming appointments via call and text to maximize show rates

~ Handle reschedules and cancellations professionally

~ Update lead statuses and notes in GHL

~ Flag any lead quality issues or client concerns to management immediately

~ Assist with basic onboarding tasks for new clients as needed



You're a Fit If You...



~ Have excellent spoken English (this is non-negotiable, you're calling Canadian homeowners)

~ Have experience in outbound/inbound calling, appointment setting, or customer service

~ Are comfortable using CRM tools like GoHighLevel, Calendly, or similar

~ Can work North American business hours (Mountain Standard Time preferred given our Alberta market)

~ Are organized and detail-oriented, nothing slips through the cracks with you

~ Are hungry and coachable, you want to grow into a bigger role as we scale

~ Have a quiet workspace, reliable internet, and a quality headset



Bonus Points For



~ Previous experience in a lead gen agency or call center environment

~ Familiarity with GoHighLevel specifically

~ Experience working with home services or contractor leads

~ Knowledge about
 Ads



What We Offer



~ $
USD per month

~ Paid training on our systems, scripts, and processes

~ Clear growth path (as we scale, this role evolves into a dedicated setter or team lead position)

~ A small, fast-moving team where your work directly impacts results

~ Performance bonuses tied to booking and show rate KPIs



How to Apply



Send a short Loom video (2 to 3 minutes) introducing yourself, explaining your relevant experience, and why you'd be great for this role. Send it to 
 with the subject line: "Your Next A-Player — [Your Name]"

title: Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist (Part-Time)



About Frontline Optics:

Frontline Optics is a premium eyewear brand built for First Responders. We focus on durability, function, and earning trust through authenticity—not hype. Our growth strategy prioritizes organic traffic, community engagement, and long-term brand loyalty over paid ads and discount-driven tactics.



The Role:

We are hiring an Organic Growth & Community Marketing Specialist to grow organic traffic, brand awareness, and non-paid revenue through authentic engagement and content across social and community-driven platforms.



This role is not about hard selling or spamming links. It’s about participating in conversations, providing value, and creating curiosity that naturally leads people to discover our brand.



Core Responsibilities:

• Schedule and post social media content

• Comment and engage on relevant Instagram and
 posts

• Participate meaningfully in
 Groups and 
 discussions  

• Write Reddit comments and threads that add value (no selling)  

• Repurpose existing brand content across platforms  

• Create short-form content for Instagram and TikTok  

• Suggest content ideas needed from the founder  

• Monitor comments and conversations and flag opportunities or issues  



Time split: ~60% engagement / ~40% content creation



Secondary Responsibilities

• Writing blog content (as needed)  

• Identifying trends and recurring conversation themes  



Brand Voice & Guidelines

• Educational, personal, insider tone  

• Speak naturally and authentically (training provided)  

• No competitor mentions  

• No discount pushing  

• No hard selling  

• Soft problem ? solution framing only  

• Donation mentions acceptable when relevant  

• No “hero” language  



Autonomy & Approval

• Pre-approved short engagement comments can be posted freely  

• Longer posts, educational threads, or personal storytelling require approval  

• When unsure ? ask for clarification  



KPIs & Success Metrics

Success is measured using a mix of hard metrics and directional trends:

• Organic website traffic growth  

• Lift in revenue not attributed to paid media  

• Referral traffic from social and community platforms  

• Engagement quality  

• Qualitative wins (mentions, screenshots, DMs)



Reporting cadence:

• Weekly summary  

• Monthly KPI deep dive  



Requirements (Must-Have)

• Prior experience with Instagram and
 brands  

• Prior Reddit brand participation  

• Comfortable clarifying content needs  

• Ability to repurpose images and B-roll  

• Strong written communication  

• Comfortable with US-based audiences  



Hours & Schedule

• 20–25 hours per week to start  

• Opportunity to scale  

• Small US overlap required  

• Start time: 6:00 AM Philippines time  



Compensation & Trial Period

• $6–$9 USD per hour  

• 90-day trial period  

• Rolling 90-day contracts if successful  

• Performance bonuses tied to KPIs  



Application Instructions

1. Review our website  

2. Submit a short recorded video explaining your organic growth strategy for the first 30, 60 and 90 days in detail.  Video should not exceed 5 minutes.   

3. Provide Resume with previous experience listed. 



Applications should be sent to 



Subject Line: Organic Growth and Community Marketing Specialist - {your name} 

***Applications without a recorded video will not be considered.***

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach & Sales Support Assistant (Part-Time, Remote) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I’m the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You’ll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:

   

        - Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

        - Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



            - brands vs retailers/stockists

            - competitors vs wholesale accounts

            - boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



-  Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1–2 minute Loom video explaining why you’re interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly analytical US Senior Accountant to support our finance operations, primarily serving US-based entities. This role plays a critical part in ensuring accurate financial reporting, strong internal controls, and timely close processes in compliance with US GAAP.



The ideal candidate is hands-on, process-driven, and comfortable operating in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.



Role Summary

The US Senior Accountant will own key areas of the general ledger, lead month-end close activities, support audit readiness, and partner cross-functionally with Finance, FP&A, and business stakeholders. This role requires strong technical accounting expertise, attention to detail, and continuous improvement mindset.



Key Responsibilities

*General Ledger & Close

Own and manage assigned GL accounts, ensuring accuracy and completeness

Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes for assigned entities

Prepare and review complex journal entries, including:

Accruals and deferrals

Revenue and expense adjustments

Depreciation and amortization

Straight-line rent

Reclassifications

Maintain and reconcile balance sheet accounts with proper supporting schedules

Perform bank reconciliations and investigate reconciling items



*Financial Reporting & Analysis

Prepare monthly financial packages and supporting schedules

Perform flux and variance analysis with clear business explanations

Support management reporting and ad hoc financial analysis

Ensure proper cutoff and period-end accuracy



*Technical Accounting & Compliance

Ensure compliance with US GAAP and company accounting policies

Support implementation and maintenance of internal controls (SOX exposure preferred)

Review transactions for proper accounting treatment

Maintain audit-ready documentation and workpapers

Support external and internal audit requests



*Fixed Assets & Multi-Entity

Manage fixed asset accounting (capitalization, depreciation, disposals, impairment)

Support multi-entity and intercompany transactions and reconciliations

Handle multi-currency accounting and FX gain/loss entries



*Cross-Functional Partnership

Act as Point of Contact (POC) for assigned entities or business units

Partner closely with AP, AR, FP&A, Payroll, and Operations

Collaborate with auditors and external partners

Support finance transformation and system improvements



*Process Improvement

Identify opportunities to automate and streamline accounting workflows

Support initiatives to accelerate the close (e.g., 15-day to 10-day close)

Assist in documenting accounting policies, SOPs, and onboarding materials

Contribute to ERP and system optimization projects



Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

Strong working knowledge of US GAAP (required)

Minimum 4–6 years of progressive accounting experience

Demonstrated ownership of month-end close

Hands-on experience with NetSuite or large ERP systems (required)

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, lookups, etc.)

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

High attention to detail and strong organizational ability

Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines

Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Qualifications

CPA or equivalent certification (strong advantage)

Public accounting background (Big 4 or mid-tier preferred)

SOX/internal controls experience

Experience supporting US-based companies

Multi-entity and multi-currency environment exposure

Experience in high-growth or PE-backed environments

Exposure to AU or Singapore entities (nice to have)



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

*Your application letter

*Unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

USSrAcct – YOUR FULL NAME



Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: Affiliate Publisher Partnerships Coordinator
description:
Work setup: Full-time, remote



Company Overview

Pearl West is building the future of consumer brands — differently.



We operate like a mini-Unilever: a lean, performance-driven team that builds and scales brands like startups, backed by private-equity-level capital and discipline.



We own and operate six consumer brands generating $40M+ in annual revenue, with additional acquisitions ahead. Each brand follows a focused 3-year scale-and-exit playbook, powered by centralized growth, creative, media, product, and operations teams.



This is operator-led brand building — not “scale and pray.” Decisions are data-backed. Execution is fast. Results directly impact the P&L.



If you want hands-on ownership and exposure to how modern e-commerce brands are built and exited, Pearl West is where you grow.



Role Overview

The Affiliate Publisher Partnerships Coordinator is an execution-focused role responsible for sourcing, coordinating, and managing publisher-led affiliate partnerships, with a strong emphasis on article-based placements, media publishers, and content sites that drive profitable Amazon revenue.



This role centers on working with publishers who create written content (reviews, listicles, comparison articles, and brand features). You will manage outreach, messaging, campaign setup, and performance tracking across Levanta and Wayward.



Experience working with influencers or creators is a plus; however, this role is primarily focused on the publishing and content affiliate ecosystem. Influencer initiatives may be involved on an as-needed basis but are not the main responsibility of the role.



Key Responsibilities

Core Responsibilities (Publisher-Focused)

Source, qualify, and coordinate affiliate publishers, editorial sites, blogs, and media partners

Lead outreach and communication with publishers regarding article placements, brand features, and affiliate content

Own day-to-day messaging with publishers covering placements, content requirements, links, commissions, and timelines

Coordinate and execute affiliate campaigns across Levanta and Wayward

Support and manage paid article placements and commission-based publishing partnerships

Onboard new publisher partners, ensuring correct affiliate tracking, links, and commission setup

Review live articles to ensure brand accuracy, proper positioning, and correct Amazon link routing

Monitor publisher placements for compliance and performance

Maintain accurate tracking of affiliate performance, commissions, and margins in Google Sheets

Track publisher-driven Amazon revenue and flag optimization or scale opportunities

Support evaluation of publisher performance to inform scaling, pausing, or renegotiation decisions

Collaborate closely with the Affiliate Manager to execute and optimize publisher-led affiliate initiative

Nice-to-Have / Supplemental Responsibilities (Not Core)

Coordinate messaging with creators or influencers when they are part of a broader affiliate placement

Support creator-based affiliate campaigns or Amazon Creator Connections when applicable

Assist with light content coordination or copy review for affiliate articles when needed

Provide input on messaging or positioning based on publisher feedback (not brand PR

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Growth in publisher-driven affiliate Amazon revenue

Number of qualified, revenue-producing publishing partners onboarded

Accuracy and reliability of affiliate tracking and reporting

Speed and consistency of execution across Levanta and Wayward

Contribution margin and commission efficienc



Success Benchmarks (30–60–90 Days)

First 30 Days

Fully onboarded into Pearl West brands, tools, and affiliate platforms

Independently executing publisher outreach, messaging, and coordination

Demonstrating strong attention to detail in article review, tracking, and link accuracy

 

60 Days

Actively managing multiple publisher partnerships and live articles

Supporting affiliate campaigns across Levanta and Wayward

Identifying early performance trends and optimization opportunities

 

90 Days

Owning execution of publisher affiliate campaigns end-to-end

Consistently driving profitable, scalable publisher-led affiliate revenue

Proactively proposing new publisher partners and article placement opportunitie



Required Skills & Qualifications

Required

Experience working with publishers, editorial sites, blogs, or media platforms

Familiarity with content publishing and article-based brand placements

Strong experience with outreach, messaging, and partner coordination

Understanding of performance-based partnerships and commission structures

Strong proficiency in Google Sheets for tracking and reporting

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and execution-focused

Comfortable operating in a performance-driven, results-accountable environmen



Nice to Have (Plus)

Affiliate marketing experience

Experience with Levanta, Wayward, or similar affiliate platforms

Copywriting or editorial experience, especially for digital content

Influencer or creator partnership experience

Amazon seller or Amazon affiliate ecosystem experience



Who Should Apply?

? You have experience working with publishers or content-driven affiliate partners

? You understand how articles and editorial placements drive affiliate revenue

? You’re comfortable managing outreach, follow-ups, and execution

? You thrive in fast-moving, execution-heavy environments



???? You’re primarily a PR, brand, or influencer marketing specialist

???? You’re new to the publishing or affiliate ecosystem

???? You prefer awareness-focused work over revenue accountability



Why Join Us?

Work directly on Amazon brands actively scaling

Real ownership over publisher-led affiliate execution

Clear expectations, fast feedback, and measurable impact

Performance-first culture with zero politics

Your work directly affects revenue, margins, and exit



Compensation & Benefits

$1,000–$1,200 USD per month, based on experience and performance

Performance-based bonuses tied to affiliate revenue and profitability

Full-time, remote work setup

Paid time off and company-recognized holidays

Long-term growth opportunities as the affiliate channel scale



To apply, kindly send your resume through this link: 



No submissions here will be entertained!
