title: UX/Graphic Designer
description:
Context

Working across a diverse portfolio of client accounts, this role is the creative engine that transforms client business goals into functional, high-impact designs. In an agency environment, this position requires the agility to switch between different brand voices and the strategic thinking to solve unique user experience challenges for various industries simultaneously.



Role Purpose

The UX/Graphic Designer is responsible for conceptualising and executing design solutions that meet specific client briefs. You will balance the "look" (Graphic Design) with the "logic" (UX Design) to ensure that every asset -- whether a landing page, a social campaign, or a brand identity -- is optimised for the client’s target audience and business objectives.



Work of the Role

Multi-Brand Design: Developing creative assets for a variety of clients, ensuring each piece aligns strictly with their specific brand identity and tone.



UX Strategy & Wireframing: Building user flows and wireframes for client websites and apps to improve navigation and conversion.



High-Fidelity UI Design: Creating polished, modern interfaces in Figma/Adobe XD that are ready for developer handoff.



Marketing Collateral: Designing high-performing ad creative,
 templates, and sales decks that drive results for client campaigns.



Client Presentation: Articulating design concepts and UX logic to clients, explaining how your creative decisions solve their business problems.



Iterative Optimisation: Using client feedback and data (Heatmaps, Google Analytics) to refine designs and improve performance post-launch.



Collaborative Sprints: Working closely with Account Managers, Google Ads Specialists, and Developers to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.



Quality Control: Ensuring all files are delivered to spec (print or digital) and maintaining organised asset libraries for every client.



Outcomes and Measures

Client Retention & Satisfaction: High marks on client feedback surveys regarding the quality and creativity of design work.



Efficiency: Managing time effectively across multiple projects, meeting all internal and client deadlines without compromising quality.



Technical Accuracy: Minimal revisions required due to technical errors or failure to follow the creative brief.



Collaboration: Seamless handoffs to the development team with clearly documented design systems and components.



Skills and Requirements

2 to 4 years of experience in a design role, preferably within a fast-paced agency environment.

Dual-Skill Mastery: A portfolio that shows a mix of beautiful graphic design (branding/layout) and smart UX thinking (user flows/prototypes).

Software Proficiency: Advanced skills in Figma (or Adobe XD) and the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).

Adaptability: The ability to pivot between different industries and design styles quickly and effectively.

Time Management: Proven ability to manage multiple projects at once while staying organised and meeting deadlines.

Communication: Comfortable presenting work to clients and taking constructive feedback with a professional, solution-oriented mindset.

title: Google Ads Specialist / PPC Specialist
description:
Context

By combining analytical expertise, operational efficiency, and strategic insight, this role ensures our advertising campaigns deliver strong results while maintaining smooth workflows and clear communication. The role bridges marketing strategy and hands-on campaign management to help drive growth for our clients.



Role Purpose

The Google Ads Specialist is responsible for managing, optimising, and reporting on Google Ads campaigns to achieve client goals. This includes keyword research, ad copy creation, bid management, performance analysis, and conversion tracking. The role ensures campaigns are executed with precision, delivering measurable results while contributing to internal team efficiency and client satisfaction.



Work of the Role

- Setting up, managing, and optimising Google Ads campaigns (Search, Display, Performance Max, YouTube, etc.) to meet performance targets.

- Conducting keyword research and audience targeting to ensure maximum campaign effectiveness.

- Writing compelling ad copy and creating variations for A/B testing.

- Monitoring campaign performance daily, identifying issues or opportunities, and implementing data-driven optimisations.

- Managing conversion tracking setups, including Google Tag Manager, to ensure accurate measurement and reporting.

- Preparing regular performance reports with insights and recommendations for improvement.

- Coordinating with internal teams to ensure campaigns align with overall marketing and business strategies.

- Maintaining organised campaign records, tracking time accurately, and meeting deadlines.

- Proactively suggesting improvements to processes, strategies, and account structures to boost ROI.



Outcomes and Measures

- Campaigns set up and launched accurately, on time, and following best practices.

- Performance metrics (CTR, CPC, ROAS, Conversion Rate) consistently meet or exceed client goals.

- Conversion tracking implemented correctly, with minimal discrepancies.

- Regular performance reports delivered on schedule, with actionable insights.

- Positive client feedback on campaign results and communication.

- Continuous optimisation efforts demonstrated through documented tests, iterations, and improvements.



Skills and Requirements

- 1–2 years of experience managing Google Ads campaigns (Search & Display required; Performance Max and YouTube are a plus).

- Proven track record of improving campaign performance through data-driven optimisation.

- Familiarity with Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics for conversion tracking.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to draw insights from data.

- Excellent attention to detail in campaign setup and reporting.

- Strong organisational and time management skills, able to handle multiple accounts or campaigns simultaneously.

- Clear written and verbal communication skills, with a collaborative and proactive approach.

- Google Ads certification is an advantage but not required.

title: Telephony Platform Lead (SIP, Vonage, Desk Phones)
description:
Company: WorkWise Auto Solutions

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Type: Full-time

Salary: Competitive, based on experience



The Project 

We're building out a multi-tenant voice communication platform for our clients, automotive workshops across Australia. End users will have flexibility: web app, mobile app, or physical desk phones for their front-desk staff.

We've chosen Vonage as our backbone. We need someone who can own the VoIP/telephony layer end-to-end: architect it, build it, and run it.





What You'll Be Doing

- Design and build our SIP trunking infrastructure using Vonage's APIs and SIP services

- Provision and configure desk phones at scale (Yealink, Polycom, Cisco, Grandstream, whatever fits)

- Integrate physical phones alongside our web/mobile softphone options into a unified system

- Manage multi-tenant voice routing, each client needs their own numbers, extensions, and call flows

- Troubleshoot call quality issues (latency, jitter, codec problems, NAT/firewall headaches)

- Work with our dev team to integrate voice into our broader platform (webhooks, call events, recordings, IVR logic via NCCO)

- Document configurations, runbooks, and provisioning processes

- Own it ongoing, this isn't a one-and-done build; you'll manage and evolve the system



What We're Looking For

   Must Have:

      - Deep experience with SIP protocol and VoIP systems

      - Hands-on work with desk phone provisioning (auto-provisioning, config files, MAC-based setup)

      - Familiarity with SIP trunking concepts (registration, authentication, codecs, NAT traversal)

      - Understanding of VoIP networking (QoS, firewall rules for SIP/RTP, STUN/TURN)

      - Ability to diagnose call quality issues and know your way around packet captures if needed

      - Comfortable working remotely and asynchronously with a distributed team

   

   Ideally, You Also Have:

       - Experience with Vonage APIs (Voice API, SIP trunking, Programmable SIP) or similar platforms (Twilio, Plivo, etc.)

       - Worked with PBX systems (FreePBX, Asterisk, 3CX) in the past

       - Familiarity with NCCO (Nexmo Call Control Objects) or similar call flow scripting

       - Experience in multi-tenant environments, you understand the complexity of managing voice for many clients

       - Some exposure to WebRTC for browser-based calling



About WorkWise Auto Solutions

We help automotive workshops run more smoothly with Virtual Service Advisors and smart operations tools. Voice communication is a critical piece; our clients talk to their customers constantly. We need the phones just to work.

Small team. Real problems to solve. Autonomy to do it your way.



Benefits

 - Competitive salary

 - Work from home – fully remote role

 - Ongoing professional development and career growth opportunities

 - Opportunities for advancement within the company

 - A supportive and collaborative team environment



To Apply

 Follow this form, thoroughly read, and go through the steps:

   
  



This is a build-it-then-run-it role. If you like owning infrastructure, we'd like to talk. ????

title: Instagram Outreach Assistant
description:
We are looking for a reliable Instagram Outreach Assistant to help us message and connect with influencers on Instagram.



Your main job will be finding influencers online and sending direct messages to start conversations. You will also engage with their content by liking posts, watching stories, leaving comments, and following accounts to help build natural connections.



You will send 50 to 100 Instagra
ssages per day using a simple script that we provide. You should be comfortable having conversations in English and keeping a friendly, natural tone.



You will track the influencers you contact in Google Sheets and update their status (Messaged, Replied, Interested, Follow-Up, etc.). At the end of each day, you will send a short report showing how many messages you sent and how many replies you received.



We are looking for someone who is consistent, organized, and dependable. You should be comfortable using Instagram daily and spending several hours doing outreach. Experience with influencer outreach, lead generation, or social media work is a plus, but not required. We care more about reliability and effort.



This is a long-term position for the right person.



Pay is $3 per hour for 20 to 40 hours per week depending on performance and availability.



To apply, please send:

A short introduction about yourself

Your weekly availability

Your internet speed

Any experience you have with Instagram or outreach

And include the word OUTREACH in your subject line



We are hiring as soon as possible.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We’re searching for an experienced assistant to execute on day-to-day activities, administrative tasks, and special projects for our CEO. 

This position touches every corner of the CEO’s life and business, which means the right person will have a passion for coming alongside the CEO and putting the infrastructure in place to bring his big vision into reality.

It’s a big role, and we need someone who has the ability to ramp up quickly when it comes to new information and learning new things. Therefore, we’re looking for someone with deep career ambitions as an assistant to the CEO and someone who truly believes in the value of this role as their calling.



Projects for you might include:

• Acting as the liaison between the CEO and his team-leaders across multiple businesses,

• Owning the logistics of important personal purchases

• Being the point person for the lawyers, partners, accountants, and more

• Coordinating travel arrangements

•Managing his calendar and inbox



Among many, many other things. 



Over time, the goal is that you’ll become an extension of our CEO by having the ability to anticipate his needs, see around the corner, and remember things before he does. Because of this, the ability to build trust quickly is critical. We desire a high level of professionalism, confidentiality, discretion and judgement, in both written and verbal communication.



Who exactly are we looking for?



In short, does this sound like you? Someone that is a(n):

• Communicator: You have excellent written and verbal communication.

• Trustworthy: A professional with a high level of discretion and honesty.

• Adaptable and Detail-Oriented: Able to work in a fast-paced environment and keep up with a proactive employer who has a clear vision and high standards.

• Dedicated and Reliable: Committed to the role personally, managing tasks independently without delegating to external teams.

• Experienced and Confident: Possesses the experience to manage priorities effectively, while confidently setting boundaries when necessary.

• Assertive and Professional: Able to communicate clearly and maintain professional boundaries, ensuring tasks are completed in a manner that aligns with both comfort and quality standards.



Why you?



As a minimum, you have:

• You have at least 1+ years of experience supporting a CEO or executive in the past. This is a must in this role, as you’ll be able to pattern match previous experiences and understand everyday shifting tasks and priorities are inherent in supporting an executive.

• You can hold your own. You make decisions decisively, and are able to take very direct feedback.

• You are a rock-solid communicator. Your present information clearly and with no errors, whether that is in written or verbal communication.

• You’re highly-adaptable and flexible, as this role is ever changing in its nature as new projects come to light as such.

• You’ll be contributing to projects related to finance and legal elements, so a strong appetite and experience in financial and legal literacy is desired.

• You thrive in fast-paced environments, with tight deadlines, with a rigorous eye for detail and accuracy

• You take a lot of pride in your outcomes, whether that’s booking just the right dinner reservation, or facilitating the final signing on a business acquisition.



To provide, more insight, the role may include, but is not limited to the following tasks:

• Meeting with the executive on a regular basis

• Compiling daily reports and communications so you can stay on the same page

• Manage and update the executive’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, patient-related appointments, internal check-ins, and personal events

• Coordinate travel, lodging, and itineraries for conferences, seminars, and events

• Screen, prioritize, and respond to
s, messages, and calls on behalf of the executive

• Draft, proofread, and send communications, memos, and announcements

• Prepare agendas, meeting materials, and presentations for leadership or tea
etings

• Take meeting notes and ensure follow-up on action items and deadlines

• Track and submit executive’s expense reports and reconcile clinic-related credit card charges

• Assist with budget tracking and light bookkeeping support for the executive’s initiatives

• Organize and maintain digital and physical files, records, and clinic documents

• Handle confidential information with discretion and ensure HIPAA compliance when needed

• Coordinate projects across departments and support clinic-wide initiatives

• Liaise with vendors, partners, and contractors, including medical equipment reps and service providers

• Prepare reports or dashboards for clinic metrics, KPIs, and executive summaries

• Manage follow-up communications with clinic partners

• Plan and coordinate team events, off sites, and leadership retreats

• Monitor and streamline executive workflows and proactively solve logistical bottlenecks

• Maintain clinic licenses, renewals, contracts, and other compliance documents as needed

• Anticipate needs and handle tasks without requiring detailed direction



Tech Requirements:

• Computer – Minimum i5 processor (or equivalent) with at least 8GB RAM.

• Internet Speed – Minimum 50 MBPS Download Speed, preferably with a backup connection to ensure uninterrupted work.



Schedule:

• Full time, 12:00PM to 8:00PM Pacific Time Zone

• Monday to Saturday



Pay:

• $1,000 - $1300 USD/month



Hiring Process:

• Phone Interview

• Executive Practical (2hrs)

• Possible Cognitive Assessment

• Interview with the Executive

• Hiring Decision Made and Communicated



How to Apply:

• Please include a link to your resume and a short introduction video along with your application. Thank you.

title: SSR Specialist (Offshore)
description:
Reports to

Installation Manager ( US BASED REMOTE) 



About This Role

The SSR Specialist plays a crucial role in the successful execution of solar installation projects by ensuring that safety protocols are adhered to and that the work site is adequately prepared for operations. This position requires a strong commitment to safety, organizational skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with installation teams to promote a culture of safety and efficiency throughout the project lifecycle.



Overall Responsibilities

?	Oversee the transportation and staging of materials on-site and on rooftops, ensuring compliance with safe handling procedures to minimize risks.

?	Assist with the installation of mounting systems, rails, and solar modules while adhering to established safety protocols and best practices.

?	Conduct regular site inspections to ensure adherence to safety procedures, including the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) by all tea
mbers.

?	Provide training and guidance to new tea
mbers on industry standards, tools, and installation techniques, fostering a culture of safety and efficiency.

?	Perform site cleanup, tool organization, and equipment checks to maintain a clean and organized work environment, contributing to overall team productivity.

?	Collaborate with the Roof Lead and Foreman to monitor installation progress, address safety concerns promptly, and enhance operational efficiency.

?	Support the implementation of safety initiatives and training programs, while actively participating in safety meetings and reporting i
 or near misses as necessary.

?	Assist with documentation related to safety procedures, site readiness, and compliance with local regulations and industry standards.





Qualifications 

?	High school diploma or equivalent; relevant experience in construction, roofing, or solar installation is preferred.

?	Strong understanding of safety regulations and protocols related to rooftop work and solar installations.

?	Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

?	Strong verbal and written communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with tea
mbers and supervisors.

?	Physical stamina and ability to work at heights, while performing physical tasks involved in solar installations.

?	Willingness to learn and adapt to industry standards and emerging technologies in the solar field.

title: Full-Time WordPress Web Developer
description:
About eTourism

eTourism is a digital marketing agency specialising in helping hotels and resorts increase direct reservations through their websites. Our focus is performance. We drive bookings, not just clicks.

We work with accommodation providers across Australia and internationally, delivering website rebuilds, SEO optimisation, content strategy, and ongoing digital marketing campaigns.

We are growing and are looking for a reliable, proactive WordPress Web Developer to join our growing team full-time.



Your Primary Responsibilities

Develop and maintain WordPress websites using the Divi Builder

Implement technical SEO best practices to improve visibility and performance

Optimise website speed, structure, and user experience

Execute development tasks based on provided designs (you are not responsible for design direction) with a focus on mobile website development & user experience

Install tracking code such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Pixel

Perform quality checks to ensure all links, booking engines, forms, and integrations function correctly

Work within an existing team structure alongside designers, marketers, and support staff

Use time-tracking software accurately and maintain strong productivity standards

Attend and actively participate in weekly production meetings



What We’re Looking For

Technical Skills

Strong experience with WordPress CMS

Advanced experience using Divi Builder

Solid understanding of on-page SEO and technical optimisation

PHP knowledge preferred (for troubleshooting and minor customisations)

Experience improving website performance and site structure

Experience using Asana or similar project management software preferred

Professional Traits (Very Important)

Excellent written English communication

Clear, proactive communication - you consistently keep the team updated on progress, blockers, and timelines

Comfortable participating in weekly production meetings

High accountability and comfort working with time-tracking systems

Proactive mindset - you take initiative rather than waiting to be told what to do

Strong attention to detail and pride in clean, accurate work

Team player who collaborates effectively with designers and marketing staff



What Success Looks Like in This Role

Websites are delivered accurately and on time

SEO improvements are implemented properly and consistently

The team is never left guessing about the status of your work

You identify issues before they become problems

You show initiative and continuously look for ways to improve systems and performance



What We Offer

Full-time, stable remote role

Long-term opportunity with a growing agency

Clear systems and structured workflow

Supportive team environment



How to Apply

Please submit:

Your resume

Links to 3–5 WordPress websites you have personally built using Divi

A short explanation of your SEO experience

A short paragraph explaining why communication and initiative are critical in a remote team

We are looking for someone long-term who takes ownership of their role and wants to grow with us.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant: includes social media and marketing management



Location: Remote

Type: Full-time



About Us

Our company is a modern real estate brokerage known for our innovative marketing, high-end branding, and commitment to excellence. We believe real estate is about more than just transactions—it’s about storytelling, design, and creating memorable experiences. We’re looking for a creative, driven, and design-savvy Social Media & Marketing Manager to help us elevate our brand and support our team of top-producing agents.



The Role

As our Social Media & Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for overseeing and growing our social media presence while designing sophisticated, on-brand marketing materials for both the company and individual agents. You’ll work directly with the team to bring creative campaigns to life, producing engaging content that captures our unique brand voice and luxury aesthetic.



Responsibilities

, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.)

- Develop and execute monthly content calendars and social media strategies

- Film, edit, and produce high-quality video content (Reels, property tours, agent spotlights, etc.)

- Collaborate with agents to design custom property and personal branding materials

- Monitor analytics to track engagement and optimize performance

- Stay up-to-date with social media trends, platform updates, and design best practices

Qualifications

- Proven experience in social media management, marketing, or creative design (real estate experience a plus)

- Expert-level proficiency in Canva, video editing (CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar), and social media tools

- Strong visual design skills with a clean, modern aesthetic and attention to detail

- Ability to take a vision or concept and execute it independently from start to finish

- Excellent communication, organization, and project management skills

- Knowledge of luxury branding and marketing principles preferred



Why Join Us

- Be part of a forward-thinking, design-driven brokerage that values creativity

- Work with an energetic, collaborative team of real estate professionals

- Opportunity to shape the visual identity of a growing brand

- Competitive pay (based on experience) and room for growth

- Stability, this job is a permanent position and offers longevity for the right applicant



How to Apply

Send your resume, portfolio or examples of past work, and a brief note about why you’d be a great fit. We need a lot of examples of your work and you will be quizzed on your design and editing skills.

mbers have their dedicated Android devices correctly configured and meet our security/operational standards.

title: Remote Software QA Tester – IoT Systems
description:
About the Role

  We are looking for a Software QA Tester with experience in both manual and automated testing.

  You will help ensure the quality, reliability, and performance of our IoT ecosystem, including mobile applications, web platforms, backend APIs, and embedded firmware. You will work closely with developers and product teams to make sure features are properly tested before release.



Key Responsibilities

  - Review requirements and create clear test plans and test cases.

  - Perform manual and automated testing for mobile apps, web applications, APIs, and IoT firmware.

  - Execute unit, integration, system, regression, and UAT testing.

  - Identify, document, and track software defects with clear reproduction steps.

  - Validate bug fixes and perform regression testing.

  - Test functional and non-functional aspects such as performance, reliability, and edge cases.

  - Participate in sprint planning, backlog discussions, and release preparation.

  - Work with developers to improve test coverage and product quality.

  - Help improve QA processes and best practices.



Requirements

  - Experience as a Software QA Tester doing manual and automated testing.

  - Good understanding of SDLC (Waterfall, Agile/Scrum workflows).

  - Experience testing mobile applications, web applications, APIs, or embedded/firmware systems.

  - Ability to write structured test cases and design test scenarios based on requirements and risk.

  - Experience using API testing tools such as Postman or similar tools.

  - Familiarity with bug tracking tools.

  - Strong analytical thinking and communication skills.



Technology Exposure (Preferred)

  - Flutter (Dart)

  - Angular

  - Java

  - C / C++ (Firmware / Embedded Systems)

  - RESTful APIs

  - Android and iOS platforms

title: Trade Analysis Virtual Assistant
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytically minded Trade Analysis Virtual Assistant to support our Finance team with day-to-day trade spend management, reporting, and data accuracy tasks. This role is ideal for someone early in their career who is highly organized, comfortable working with numbers, and eager to learn how trade spend and promotional

analysis work within a CPG environment.



You will play a critical role in ensuring that trade data is accurate, current, and well-organized so the Finance team can make informed business decisions.



Key Responsibilities

Trade Spend Support & Data Management

Maintain and update trade spend trackers, deduction logs, and promotional calendars.

Support coding, categorization, and reconciliation of trade deductions and customer invoices.

Enter and organize customer promotional plans, pricing changes, and discount structures.

Assist with verifying claims and matching data between retailer portals, internal systems, and broker submissions.



Reporting & Analysis

Pull, clean, and structure sales and trade data for weekly and monthly reporting.

Prepare basic analyses on spend vs. plan, ROI of promotions, and deduction trends.

Flag discrepancies, unusual variances, or data quality issues for Finance review.

Compile retailer performance metrics, promo recaps, and spend summaries.



Administrative & Operational Support

Maintain shared folders, naming conventions, and documentation for trade processes.

Coordinate with brokers, sales teams, and accounting for missing data or clarifications.

Support ad-hoc requests such as customer form completion, pricing updates, or retailer portal uploads.

Assist with data audits during month-end close.



Qualifications

3 years of experience in data entry, administrative support, accounting support, or

similar roles (CPG experience a bonus but not required).

Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills (v-lookup, pivot tables, basic formulas).

High attention to detail and comfort managing numerical data.

Excellent organizational and documentation skills.

Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and communicate clearly.

Familiarity with retailer portals, trade spend tools, or ERP systems is an asset (but not

mandatory).



Who You Are

Highly dependable and consistent — you like clean data and organized systems.

Curious and willing to learn how trade spending works in CPG.

Comfortable communicating with cross-functional teams to gather missing

information.

A problem-solver who enjoys finding (and fixing) inconsistencies in data.



Please send a link to your resume to apply.

About Us

Administration

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
About Stellata Partners

Stellata Partners is a private investment firm focused on middle-market investment opportunities in the United States. Stellata Partners is run by an alumnus from Harvard Business School with experience in investment banking and private equity across a variety of industries. We operate in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and work closely with leadership day-to-day.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a Virtual Assistant (VA) to support proprietary deal sourcing efforts and general administrative needs. You’ll be a key execution partner for:

• List building for outbound campaigns

• Contact enrichment and data hygiene

• Cold calling and follow-up

• General VA operations support (scheduling, research, light admin)



You’ll work directly with the Founder/Managing Partner and help keep the sourcing engine running smoothly.



Key Responsibilities



1) Cold Calling + Follow-Up (Primary)

• Place outbound calls to business owners and executives using provided scripts and talk tracks

• Qualify leads and capture structured notes (business profile, ownership intent, timing, objections)

• Route interested prospects to the next step (calendar scheduling, intro
, information request)

• Maintain high professionalism and compliance with calling best practices and internal guidelines



2) General Virtual Assistant Support (Secondary)

• Inbox triage support (labeling, routing, drafting basic replies for review)

• Scheduling and coordination (calls, reminders, follow-up cadences)

• Light operations tasks and ad hoc projects to keep workflows organized



Qualifications

• Prior experience in sourcing, outreach, or pipeline/CRM support, ideally supporting a search fund or investment firm workflow

• Instantly/Smartlead, 
, HubSpot, Pipedrive, or Airtable

• Microsoft Excel and Outlook proficiency

• Comfortable making cold calls to U.S. business owners and handling objections with professionalism

• Strong attention to detail and high quality standards in data work

• Highly organized and reliable with deadlines, task tracking, and follow-through

• Excellent spoken and written English (fluency required)

• Please mention if you are from an English speaking country such as Belize or South Africa. 



What We Are Looking For 

• Comfort working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment 

• Proactive mindset and initiative-taking attitude 

• Ability to learn quickly and take feedback 

• Consistent high-quality performance and keen attention to detail 

• Strong analytical, research, and communication capabilities 



Schedule: Part-time or full-time (based on fit); ability to overlap with U.S. Central Time (CT) is a plus



Note: In your message, please include a list of all lead generation/sourcing tools and databases that you 1) currently have access to and 2) do not have access to but have experience using in prior roles. Also please include a link to proof of your english speaking abilities.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Manager to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Part-Time Meta Ads Operator (Execution Focused)
description:
About Us

We’re a programming education company that helps experienced software engineers build real-world Rust projects and land Rust roles. We run a high-ticket, cohort-based accelerator plus self-paced training, and reach engineers through YouTube,
, and partnerships.



Role Overview

We are looking for a part-time Meta Ads Operator to implement and maintain our
 and Instagram campaigns. This is an execution-focused role: you will take clear targeting and creative direction from the founder and marketing team, then handle setup, tracking, and ongoing optimizations inside Meta Ads Manager.



Ideal for someone who enjoys clean accounts, accurate tracking, and making data-driven tweaks, not sitting in branding meetings.



Key Responsibilities

1. Implement and maintain Meta Pixel and Conversion API across our funnels (waitlist, applications, bookings, purchases).

2. Set up campaigns, ad sets, and ads according to provided specs (objectives, budgets, audiences, and creatives).

3. Create and manage custom and lookalike audiences from our traffic,
 list, and engaged users.

4. Monitor performance daily on weekdays and execute simple rules: pause obvious losers, keep winners within defined guardrails, and flag issues quickly.

5. Run basic A/B tests on creatives and audiences following our testing framework.

6. Ensure tracking events fire correctly on all key steps and troubleshoot when they do not.

7. Produce a concise weekly report (spend, cost per waitlist opt-in, cost per application, cost per call, cost per student) with 2 to 3 clear recommendations.



You Are A Good Fit If

1. You have 1 to 3 years of hands-on experience running Meta Ads (lead gen or info/education experience is a plus).

2. You are comfortable with Meta Ads Manager, Pixel, standard events, and basic CAPI.

3. You can read numbers and make simple performance-based decisions without drama.

4. You are organized, responsive, and document what you do so others can follow it.

5. You can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours per day with US time zones.

6. You’re currently freelancing or working part?time and want a long?term core client, not just a one?off project.



This Role Is Not

1. Not a creative director or copywriter (we have a content and
 team).

2. Not a CMO or growth strategist d
 offers, funnels, or pricing.

3. Not a general social media manager (no organic posting, community management, or influencer work).



Scope & Engagement

1. Part-time contractor.

2. We’ll start at 5–10 hours/week for the first 60–90 days while we validate and scale Meta.

3. We guarantee a minimum of 20 hours/month, paid monthly, so your time is predictable.

4. If performance is strong and we scale ad spend, this role can grow into 15–20+ hours/week and potentially a full-time PH position.

5. Remote, flexible schedule as long as SLAs are met and campaigns are monitored on weekdays.



How To Apply



Please reply to this job post with the following:

1. A brief summary of your Meta Ads experience, including typical monthly budgets.

2. Screenshots or summaries of 2 to 3 campaigns you have managed (goal, budget, structure, and results).

3. One paragraph on how you normally set up tracking (pixel, events, CAPI) for a lead gen funnel.

4. Your part-time hourly rate and full-time monthly rate, respectively.

title: Sales Representative
description:
Join a fast-growing US online home goods retailer and enjoy the learning and opportunities that you have while working with us.



We strive to provide 5-star service & shopping assistance to all of our clients, and all of our team is accountable to fulfill this.



We are looking for a Sales Representative who can assist prospective buyers and close online ecommerce sales.



We're only looking for full-time, long-term, ongoing cooperation.



Work schedules available:

8 AM to 4 PM US EST

4 PM to 12 AM US EST



Your work week will be 5 days per week, with 2 days off per week. Days off will be selected with your manager. We will try to accommodate your preferences for which days you like, based on availability.



This role starts ASAP.



Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them



Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in sales on the phone

Experience must include both inbound and outbound sales

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Experience in Customer Service on the phone is a nice to have

Experience in the e-commerce (online shopping) industry is nice to have

Home improvement, construction, and gas plumbing industry experience is a plus

Outgoing, friendly, and lively

Can-do mindset, with a sense of ownership, pride in your performance, and its impact on the company’s success

Long-term commitment - treat this as your career



What we can offer:

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping costs. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position

title: Full-Time Performance Concierge (AI-Savvy Operations & Customer Support VA)
description:
Full-Time Performance Concierge (AI-Savvy Operations & Customer Support VA)



Overview



I run a high-level online golf coaching business serving driven professionals.



I’m looking for a full-time Performance Concierge — someone highly organized, AI-fluent, fast, detail-oriented, and proactive.



This is not a basic VA role.



You will act as an operations coordinator + customer success assistant + execution partner. You must be extremely responsive, comfortable using AI tools daily, and able to manage multiple moving parts without constant supervision.



If you need step-by-step instructions for everything, this role is not for you.



If you take ownership, close loops, and move quickly — keep reading.



Core Responsibilities



1. Customer Support & Student Experience



Monitor and respond to
 and DMs



Help students with access, billing, scheduling, and tech issues



Follow up on unanswered messages



Ensure no conversation is left open



Maintain a professional, friendly tone



2. Operations & Admin



Manage task boards (ClickUp / Asana / similar)



Organize documents, SOPs, and internal systems



CRM updates and tagging



Booking coordination and calendar management



Light research and logistics support



3. Content & AI Support



Use ChatGPT and other AI tools daily



Draft captions,
s, and summaries



Repurpose content



Upload and schedule social media content



Help build structured documents from transcripts



4. Performance Tracking



Track leads and follow-ups



Keep pipeline clean



Ensure deadlines are met



Provide daily end-of-shift summary



What I Expect



Fast acknowledgement of messages during working hours



Clear communication



Extreme organization



Ability to prioritize without being told every detail



Comfort with structured systems



Proactive problem solving



You will be measured on:



Responsiveness



Accuracy



Initiative



Follow-through



Communication clarity



Required Skills



Excellent written English



Strong AI usage (ChatGPT, etc.)



High-level organization skills



Familiar with Google Workspace



Comfortable with project management tools



Fast learner



Preferred (Not Required)



Experience supporting coaches or online businesses



Familiarity with HubSpot, ConvertKit, ClickFunnels, Circle



Light video or content editing experience



Working Hours



Full-time (40 hours per week)



Compensation



Competitive full-time salary based on experience.



To be discussed during interview.



IMPORTANT – HOW TO APPLY



To be considered, follow these instructions exactly:



Subject line must be:

“Performance Concierge – Ready to Execute”



In your application, answer the following:



What AI tools do you use daily and how?



How do you ensure no task gets forgotten?



What does “closing the loop” mean to you?



What is your expected monthly salary?



Include the word “Precision” somewhere in your application so I know you read everything.



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.
